title: Link text sometimes differs in link replacement form

labels.name: prio: medium
labels.description: Should be scheduled in the forseeable future.

milestone.title: 23Q2
milestone.description: Second quarter 2023

body:
### Describe the Bug
<!-- A clear and concise description of what the bug is. -->
Since I added the disabled link text field to the link replacement form, there seem to be edge cases where the link text differs in the table row and the form field, which might be confusing. Both links belong to the same URL, but there seems to be no apparent reason why both variants should be shown here. Using the same would be better.

### Steps to Reproduce

1. Go to linkcheck list
2. Replace URL that has more than one link
3. See different link text (sometimes)

### Expected Behavior
<!-- A clear and concise description of what you expected to happen. -->
The link texts should be identical

### Actual Behavior
<!-- A clear and concise description of what actually happened. -->
They are differing:
![Screenshot 2023-04-19 at 19-48-27 Integreat Editorial System](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/16021269/233158725-3d417d2f-9e8e-45a7-a815-d9e6f54d2a0e.png)

title: "HIX value too low for MT" error message shown even when automatic MT is unchecked

milestone.title: 23Q2
milestone.description: Second quarter 2023

body:
### Describe the Bug
<!-- A clear and concise description of what the bug is. -->
When attempting to automatically translate a page with insufficient HIX score, an error message is shown to the user. However, this message is now also shown when the user did not attempt to automatically translate

### Steps to Reproduce

1. Go to any German page form view
2. Uncheck automatic MT checkbox
3. Chenge the text to something with a low HIX value (optional, makes no difference: refresh the HIX score)
4. click Publish
5. receive error message

### Expected Behavior
<!-- A clear and concise description of what you expected to happen. -->
The error is only shown if the user actually attempted to use MT

### Actual Behavior
<!-- A clear and concise description of what actually happened. -->
The error is always shown

<!-- Add any other context (e.g. logs, screenshots, etc.) about the problem here. -->

title: Broken HIX loading animation when DeepL is enabled

labels.name: prio: low
labels.description: Not urgent, can be resolved in the distant future.

milestone.title: 23Q2
milestone.description: Second quarter 2023

body:
### Describe the Bug
When I open a page and the HIX widget is not loaded yet, it shows the message, that supposedly there was no content on my pages, which is not true. Usually this issue resolves itself as soon as the HIX widget is loaded, however when ever the HIX service is not available, this message stays for a while (ca. 30 seconds, before showing the error message, that HIX isn't available). This is not a huge probem, but it might cause some confusion.


### Steps to Reproduce

0. Enable DeepL by setting a key in the config file and enable HIX in the region settings
1. Go to pages
2. Select a page
3. See error in HIX box (error resolves itself as soon as the widget is loaded)

### Expected Behavior
Show an error message like "HIX widget is loading..." or something similar


### Actual Behavior
<!-- A clear and concise description of what actually happened. -->
Shows untrue error message "No content on page"

### Additional Information
![Bildschirmfoto von 2023-04-11 17-08-10](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/72705147/231209824-a72f4699-a368-4821-83de-7795e677c0d4.png)

title: Unable to replace malformed `mailto:` or `tel:` links

labels.name: prio: low
labels.description: Not urgent, can be resolved in the distant future.

milestone.title: 23Q2
milestone.description: Second quarter 2023

body:
### Describe the Bug
<!-- A clear and concise description of what the bug is. -->
Email and tel links are hidden in the broken link checker, so normally they do not show up.
However, when they are malformed in any way, e.g. a link was created `https://tel:12345`, it's impossible to fix this problem in the broken link checker, because it only accepts valid URLs, not valid email or tel links.

### Steps to Reproduce

1. Create malformed tel link in content
2. Try to fix problem in broken link checker
3. See validation error

### Expected Behavior
<!-- A clear and concise description of what you expected to happen. -->
It should be possible to replace incorrect links, even if they use `mailto:` or `tel:` targets.

### Actual Behavior
<!-- A clear and concise description of what actually happened. -->
Only links with `http://`/`https://` can be replaced

### Additional Information
<!-- Add any other context (e.g. logs, screenshots, etc.) about the problem here. -->

title: Event API caches old result after setting an event to draft

milestone.title: 23Q2
milestone.description: Second quarter 2023

body:
### Describe the Bug
<!-- A clear and concise description of what the bug is. -->
Events are still delivered via the events API when the result is cached via django-cachalot.

### Steps to Reproduce

1. Enable redis cache
2. Fetch events API to populate cache
3. Set event to draft
4. Fetch events API again

### Expected Behavior
<!-- A clear and concise description of what you expected to happen. -->
An event that is set to draft should not be delivered via the API

### Actual Behavior
<!-- A clear and concise description of what actually happened. -->
The event is still delivered when the result is cached and not manually invalidated

### Additional Information
<!-- Add any other context (e.g. logs, screenshots, etc.) about the problem here. -->

```
<textarea dir="rtl"></textarea>
```

title: `hix_ignore` field reset after non expert user saved page form

milestone.title: 23Q1
milestone.description: First quarter 2023

body:
### Describe the Bug
<!-- A clear and concise description of what the bug is. -->
When `hix_ignore` is True for a page, the field is no longer rendered on the page form (and a small warning text instead).
In HTML, a missing checkbox is equivalent to an unchecked one, thus on form submission, this counts as if the checkbox had been unchecked.
So we have to re-add the checkbox and just make it invisible when a non expert user renders the form.

### Steps to Reproduce

1. Set `hix_ignore` to `True` with an expert user
2. Open the page form of the same page with a non expert user
3. Save
4. See HIX widget

### Expected Behavior
<!-- A clear and concise description of what you expected to happen. -->
The HIX value should stay ignored if it was before and the form is saved by a non expert user

### Actual Behavior
<!-- A clear and concise description of what actually happened. -->
`hix_ignore` is disabled when a non expert user saves the page

title: Hix loading animation overflows the hix widget

labels.name: prio: medium
labels.description: Should be scheduled in the forseeable future.

milestone.title: 23Q1
milestone.description: First quarter 2023

body:
### Describe the Bug
<!-- A clear and concise description of what the bug is. -->
The Hix loading animation (blurred background and the loading spinner) spans across the whole sidebar (and beyond).

### Steps to Reproduce

1. Enable Hix
2. Go to a page form
3. If you want to inspect this longer, add a `import time; time.sleep(10)` to [integreat_cms/cms/views/utils/hix.py](https://github.com/digitalfabrik/integreat-cms/blob/c6c5fa1ae6752a02b5ce0d5e0703ad30d23214b7/integreat_cms/cms/views/utils/hix.py#L44)
4. See broken loading animation

### Expected Behavior
<!-- A clear and concise description of what you expected to happen. -->
Only the hix widget should be affected by the loading animation

### Actual Behavior
<!-- A clear and concise description of what actually happened. -->
The whole sidebar is affected

### Additional Information
<!-- Add any other context (e.g. logs, screenshots, etc.) about the problem here. -->
![Screenshot 2023-03-22 at 14-58-49 Integreat Editorial System](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/16021269/226928408-b58a597f-e049-4005-b534-0fe61ece6776.png)

title: Translation coverage produces a lot of sql queries

labels.name: prio: medium
labels.description: Should be scheduled in the forseeable future.

milestone.title: 23Q1
milestone.description: First quarter 2023

body:
### Describe the Bug
<!-- A clear and concise description of what the bug is. -->
We got the translation coverage down to a constant number of queries some time ago, but now the view has become very slow again, so apparently there was a side effect on one of our latest changes.

### Steps to Reproduce

1. Go to translation coverage
2. See number of queries in Django debug toolbar

### Expected Behavior
<!-- A clear and concise description of what you expected to happen. -->
The number of queries should not depend on the number of pages in the database

### Actual Behavior
<!-- A clear and concise description of what actually happened. -->
There are some queries executed in a loop, so the more pages, the more sql queries

title: Outdated machine translations not marked as outdated

milestone.title: 23Q1
milestone.description: First quarter 2023

body:
### Describe the Bug
<!-- A clear and concise description of what the bug is. -->
Machine translations are marked with the "bot" icon indefinitely, even if they're outdated.

### Steps to Reproduce

1. Create machine translation
2. Change source translation without updating the bot translation
3. See bot icon

### Expected Behavior
<!-- A clear and concise description of what you expected to happen. -->
Outdated translations should be flagged as outdated, no matter where they come from.
The bot icon should only be used for machine translations that are up to date.

### Actual Behavior
<!-- A clear and concise description of what actually happened. -->
Currently, the bot icon overrides the outdated icon

title: `DeepLException` during MT for languages with faulty bcp tag

labels.name: prio: low
labels.description: Not urgent, can be resolved in the distant future.

milestone.title: 23Q1
milestone.description: First quarter 2023

body:
### Describe the Bug
If you try to use the MT for languages with a faulty bcp tag Django errors occur. This issue is quite relevant, because in our live system quite a few bcp codes are filled out "incorrectly", and therefore we would run into a lot of issues when releasing our implementation in April.


### Steps to Reproduce

1. Go to ''languages" and create a language that a. instead of the bcp tag uses a slug and b. create another language that has an incorrect bcp tag
2. Then click on 'event' or 'locations', ǵo to either one of the newly created languages
3. Select pages and use the bulk action for machine translation
4. In both cases, see the error 
![grafik](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/72705147/224963832-05dd6e2e-8df1-40c1-8a60-1240969928e5.png)

### Expected Behavior
<!-- A clear and concise description of what you expected to happen. -->
Even in cases where instead of the bcp code the slug is filled in the translation should work. And for cases in which the bcp code is filled in incorrectly (e.g. pt_PT instead of pt-PT) there should be an informative error message.

### Actual Behavior
<!-- A clear and concise description of what actually happened. -->
In both cases that I described above a django error message appears (see screenshot)


### Additional Information
<!-- Add any other context (e.g. logs, screenshots, etc.) about the problem here. -->
The underlying problem is probably that we check the language slugs when testing for DeepL availability, but when we're actually translating we're sending the bcp tag. This error also appears while using the translation box in our page form, introduced by #2062

title: Location endpoint raises internal server error when default translation is not public

milestone.title: 23Q1
milestone.description: First quarter 2023

body:
### Describe the Bug
<!-- A clear and concise description of what the bug is. -->
When a region creates a location which is a draft in the default language, but public in other languages, the location API returns an internal server error

### Steps to Reproduce

1. Create location as draft in default language
2. Publish location in different language
3. Access location API (e.g. https://admin.integreat-app.de/api/maintal/en/locations/)
4. See error

### Expected Behavior
<!-- A clear and concise description of what you expected to happen. -->
1. It should not be possible to publish a POI translation in a different language when the default translation is not public
2. In case this inconsistent state is reached anyway, the API should not deliver those POIs.

### Actual Behavior
<!-- A clear and concise description of what actually happened. -->
The database inconsistency causes an internal server error

### Additional Information
<!-- Add any other context (e.g. logs, screenshots, etc.) about the problem here. -->

<details>
  <summary>Traceback</summary>

  ```
Feb 23 15:52:35 ERROR   django.request - 500 Internal Server Error: /maintal/en/wp-json/extensions/v3/locations/?on_map=1
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/opt/integreat-cms/.venv/lib/python3.9/site-packages/django/core/handlers/exception.py", line 47, in inner
    response = get_response(request)
  File "/opt/integreat-cms/.venv/lib/python3.9/site-packages/django/core/handlers/base.py", line 181, in _get_response
    response = wrapped_callback(request, *callback_args, **callback_kwargs)
  File "/opt/integreat-cms/.venv/lib/python3.9/site-packages/integreat_cms/api/decorators.py", line 124, in wrap
    return function(request, *args, **kwargs)
  File "/opt/integreat-cms/.venv/lib/python3.9/site-packages/integreat_cms/api/v3/locations.py", line 149, in locations
    result.append(transform_poi_translation(translation))
  File "/opt/integreat-cms/.venv/lib/python3.9/site-packages/integreat_cms/api/v3/locations.py", line 75, in transform_poi_translation
    "title": poi.default_public_translation.title,
AttributeError: 'NoneType' object has no attribute 'title'
  ```

</details>

This is a regression from 70630ff7441bac673aeccde0a81e1d98e1d4ad49 (#2057).

milestone.description: First quarter 2023

body:
### Describe the Bug
<!-- A clear and concise description of what the bug is. -->
The pylint output is barely readable since the last update

`./dev-tools/pylint.sh`

### Expected Behavior
<!-- A clear and concise description of what you expected to happen. -->
Readable output

### Actual Behavior
<!-- A clear and concise description of what actually happened. -->
A ton of these warnings:
```
pylint: Command line or configuration file:1: UserWarning: Specifying exception names in the overgeneral-exceptions option without module name is deprecated and support for it will be removed in pylint 3.0. Use fully qualified name (maybe 'builtins.Exception' ?) instead.
```

We could also think about changing the code how pylint suggest (naming the whole module path when raising exceptions)...

title: Gap in sidebar when boxes are collapsed

labels.name: prio: low
labels.description: Not urgent, can be resolved in the distant future.

milestone.title: 23Q1
milestone.description: First quarter 2023

body:
### Describe the Bug
<!-- A clear and concise description of what the bug is. -->
When there is only one sidebar and some boxes in the upper part are collapsed, there is a bit of unused space between the two segments of the sidebar (Also see https://github.com/digitalfabrik/integreat-cms/issues/1769#issuecomment-1344607096).

### Steps to Reproduce

1. Go to page form
2. Adapt screen resolution until exactly one sidebar is shown
3. Collapse box in upper part of the sidebar
4. See spacing

### Expected Behavior
<!-- A clear and concise description of what you expected to happen. -->
The collapsing should cause the lower boxes to move upwards. Maybe we should define a grid that only has one column when there's only space for one sidebar and two columns otherwise, instead of wrapping the two columns around which causes the space?

### Actual Behavior

There is spacing between them

### Additional Information

An unexpected TS error is sometimes being thrown on various pages. This error appears to block the site from loading fully, including preventing `window.addEventListener("load", ...)` event listeners from firing.

![error](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/47758554/214045525-ea974179-a377-416b-a6af-9a52988df53e.png)

### Steps to Reproduce

1. Go to (e.g.) http://localhost:8000/augsburg/feedback/

### Expected Behavior
<!-- A clear and concise description of what you expected to happen. -->
No error, page loads fully

### Actual Behavior
<!-- A clear and concise description of what actually happened. -->
Sometimes an unexpected error prevents the page from loading fully

title: Links found in archived pages after cloning region

milestone.title: 23Q1
milestone.description: First quarter 2023

body:
### Describe the Bug
<!-- A clear and concise description of what the bug is. -->
When a region is cloned, the link checker of the new region contains links in archived pages, even if these links were not present in the source region.

### Steps to Reproduce

1. Create region with archived pages that contain links
2. See link checker of that region which does not contain the links in archived pages
3. Clone that region to a new region
4. See link checker of the new region which now contains the links in archived pages

### Expected Behavior
<!-- A clear and concise description of what you expected to happen. -->
The cloned region should also exclude links in archived pages

### Actual Behavior
<!-- A clear and concise description of what actually happened. -->
The cloned region has links in archived pages

### Additional Information
<!-- Add any other context (e.g. logs, screenshots, etc.) about the problem here. -->

milestone.title: 23Q1
milestone.description: First quarter 2023

body:

<!-- A clear and concise description of what the bug is. -->
The end date of recurring events is incorrectly set to the end date of the initial occurrence of the event in the API response.

### Steps to Reproduce

1. Retrieve events API http://localhost:8000/api/augsburg/de/events/
2. See incorrect date

### Expected Behavior
<!-- A clear and concise description of what you expected to happen. -->
The end date should contain the end date of the specific occurrence

The end date of the initial even is used

https://github.com/digitalfabrik/integreat-cms/blob/718a9113d2d727f33bfc3f82c5731518d5172c67/tests/api/expected-outputs/augsburg_de_events.json#L96-L101

title: Change page parent broken in page form

milestone.title: 22Q4
milestone.description: Fourth quarter 2022

body:
### Describe the Bug
When trying to change the page parent of a page on level 2 and move it into level 3 by changing the page parent, a JavaScript error occurs.


### Steps to Reproduce

1. Open any page on level 2
2. Choose another level 2 page as new parent
3. An error occurs in `Order` box instead of the drop down
4. When saving the page the page parent is not updated

### Expected Behavior
A list of pages should appear.


### Actual Behavior
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/15197000/209096740-ac041746-a0d0-457f-9416-7bff72d1e6ae.png)

### Additional Information
* No browser console errors
* The error fist appeared with the [2022.12.0](https://github.com/digitalfabrik/integreat-cms/pull/1944) release
* The error message reads `raw is undefined` in development mode

title: PDF export not working in Greek

milestone.title: 22Q4
milestone.description: Fourth quarter 2022

body:
### Describe the Bug
<!-- A clear and concise description of what the bug is. -->
When pages in Greek are exported as PDF, TOC (Table of Contents) and headlines are broken.

### Steps to Reproduce

1. Go to a region which offers pages in Greek.
2. Export pages as PDF.
3. See TOC and headlines are not displayed correctly.

### Expected Behavior
<!-- A clear and concise description of what you expected to happen. -->
TOC and headlines are displayed in greek letters.
Add PDF export test for Greek too.

### Actual Behavior
<!-- A clear and concise description of what actually happened. -->
TOC and headlines are displayed as boxes.
No test for PDF export in Greek.

### Additional Information

title: Disable page order section for observers without edit/change permission

labels.name: prio: low
labels.description: Not urgent, can be resolved in the distant future.

milestone.title: 23Q1
milestone.description: First quarter 2023

body:
### Describe the Bug
<!-- A clear and concise description of what the bug is. -->
Observers can change the page order by drag&drop even if they are not allowed to change/edit the page. Even though such changes will not be saved when no change/edit permission is granted, it is confusing and therefore must be disabled.

### Steps to Reproduce

1. Log in as observer
2. Go to a page for which this observer has no permission to change/edit
3. Go to "Order" section
4. See drag&drop is possible

### Expected Behavior
<!-- A clear and concise description of what you expected to happen. -->
Observers cannot drag&drop the page order if they do not have change/edit permission for this page.

### Actual Behavior
<!-- A clear and concise description of what actually happened. -->
Observers can drag&drop.

title: Hide page link edit button for observers wihout change/edit permission

milestone.title: 23Q1
milestone.description: First quarter 2023

body:
### Describe the Bug
<!-- A clear and concise description of what the bug is. -->
An edit-button (pen icon) next to the page link is shown in the page form for observer users, even when they do not have permission to edit the page.
Since it does not make sense to show this icon while the user is not allowed to change/edit the page, it should be hidden when changing/editing permission is not granted.

### Steps to Reproduce

1. Log in as observer.
2. Go to a page for which this observer does not have permission to change/edit.
3. See the edit-icon is shown.

### Expected Behavior
<!-- A clear and concise description of what you expected to happen. -->
The edit icon is not shown if the observer user cannot change/edit the page.

### Actual Behavior
<!-- A clear and concise description of what actually happened. -->
The edit icon is shown even if they cannot change/edit the page.

### Additional Information
<!-- Add any other context (e.g. logs, screenshots, etc.) about the problem here. -->
In the pages which are shared with the observer (for exmaple by page-specific permission) the button should appear.


<details>
  <summary>Traceback</summary>

  ```
  ```

</details>

title: Fix permission for Observer role in Media Library

milestone.title: 23Q1
milestone.description: First quarter 2023

body:
### Describe the Bug
<!-- A clear and concise description of what the bug is. -->
Currently users with role "Observer" can replace files in the media library, and a network error occurs when they try to delete a file.

However, they should not be allowed to delete or replace any files. Only uploading shoud be possible for them.


### Steps to Reproduce
1. Upload some files as root user.
2. Log out once and log in as observer.
3. Go to Media Library.
4. Try to delete/replace a file.


### Expected Behavior
<!-- A clear and concise description of what you expected to happen. -->
Buttons "Replace file" and "Delete file" are not available for observers, and replacing/deleting requests will be rejected if the user is an observer.

### Actual Behavior
<!-- A clear and concise description of what actually happened. -->
The buttons are shown, deleting will be rejected but triggers a network error, replacing will not be rejected.

### Additional Information
<!-- Add any other context (e.g. logs, screenshots, etc.) about the problem here. -->
Add also a warning "You don't have permission to delete or replace files but you can upload files" on the top part of  the media library, as in the page tree, poi/event lists.


<details>
  <summary>Traceback</summary>

  ```
  ```

</details>

milestone.title: 22Q4

body:
### Describe the Bug
<!-- A clear and concise description of what the bug is. -->
When the newest version of a translation is a minor edit and this page is imported as XLIFF, the `minor_edit` field is set even after the import, meaning the translation status does not change.

### Steps to Reproduce

1. Create latest version with minor edit in target language
2. Export as XLIFF and re-import without changes
3. Confirm
4. See translation status still outdated

<!-- A clear and concise description of what you expected to happen. -->
An XLIFF import should never be considered a minor edit and always cause the page to be up to date after import

### Actual Behavior

The translation status stays outdated when latest version is minor edit

<!-- Add any other context (e.g. logs, screenshots, etc.) about the problem here. -->

title: Words with Umlaute are not translated by DeepL

milestone.title: 23Q1
milestone.description: First quarter 2023

body:
### Describe the Bug
<!-- A clear and concise description of what the bug is. -->
Words with Umlaute are not translated by DeepL.

### Steps to Reproduce

1. create an event, and in its description use a word with an Umlaut
2. translate the event with DeepL
3. everything is correctly translated, except for the word containing the Umlaut

### Expected Behavior
<!-- A clear and concise description of what you expected to happen. -->
Everything is translated correctly


### Actual Behavior
<!-- A clear and concise description of what actually happened. -->
Words with Umlaute are not translated at all

### Additional Information
<!-- Add any other context (e.g. logs, screenshots, etc.) about the problem here. -->
We are not actually sending the Umlaute, but HTML-escpaped characters. Unescaping these before sending to DeepL should fix the issue.

title: Minor Edit checkbox should be unchecked for new versions

milestone.title: 22Q4
milestone.description: Fourth quarter 2022

body:
### Describe the Bug
When saving a page as minor version, the checkbox will be set (true) for the next version. I need to actively unset the minor version checkbox. However, it should be an active choice for each version to make it a minor version. The default should always be a major version.


### Steps to Reproduce

1. Open any page and save a new minor version.
2. Reopen the page and see that the checkbox is still set to true.
3. Save again and the next version will also be a minor version. Without user interaction it should be major.

### Expected Behavior
The minor version checkbox should not be set when opening the page form.


### Actual Behavior
The minor version checkbox **is set** when the previous version is a minor edit.


### Additional Information
https://chat.tuerantuer.org/digitalfabrik/pl/3mw9t79df7gw9kydp4qnke7hya

title: Cannot submit feedback for fallback translation of recurring event

milestone.title: 22Q4
milestone.description: Fourth quarter 2022

body:
### Describe the Bug
The pathname of a recurrent event contains the date of an explicit event (in the frontend). 
E.g. https://webnext.integreat.app/testumgebung/de/events/spieleabend$2022-11-16
This pathname is provided by the backend.
However, the actual slug should not contain the date of the event. In the example above the slug is `spieleabend`. 
It is possible to remove the date from the slug in the rontend but in fact this should probably be done in the backend. Either supply the event slug in the api, or make sending feedback with the slug containing the date work.

### Steps to Reproduce

```bash
curl --location --request POST 'https://cms-test.integreat-app.de/testumgebung/ar/wp-json/extensions/v3/feedback/event' \
--form 'comment="asdf"' \
--form 'slug="spieleabend$2022-11-16"'
```

### Expected Behavior
̀Submitting feedback works:
`{"success": "Feedback successfully submitted"}`

### Actual Behavior
Submitting feedback fails with: 
`{"error": "No matching location found for slug."}`



</details>

title: Region selection broken for editors

body:
### Describe the Bug
The region selection after login is broken for users that are assigned to multiple regions. The users sees a `Internal Server Error Error 500` after entering the username.

### Steps to Reproduce

1. Create an user without superadmin privileges
2. Assign the user to multiple regions
3. Log in with the newly created user
4. After being redirected to `/` after the login, the 500 error appears

### Expected Behavior
A list of assigned regions should appear.


### Actual Behavior
An error 500 is shown.


### Additional Information
<!-- Add any other context (e.g. logs, screenshots, etc.) about the problem here. -->

<details>
  <summary>Traceback</summary>

  ```
Nov 09 07:51:36 ERROR   django.request - 500 Internal Server Error: /
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/opt/integreat-cms/.venv/lib/python3.9/site-packages/django/core/handlers/exception.py", line 47, in inner
    response = get_response(request)
  File "/opt/integreat-cms/.venv/lib/python3.9/site-packages/django/core/handlers/base.py", line 204, in _get_response
    response = response.render()
  ```

title: Broken Link Checker stops when facing URL longer than 255 chars

milestone.title: 23Q1
milestone.description: First quarter 2023

body:
### Describe the Bug
It seems that the broken link check LIFO queue is not being checked to the end if an error occurs. That means that if many links are checked at once (queue is being filled with many links) and one error occurs, many links are not being checked. The queue seems to live in memory and not in the database.


### Steps to Reproduce

1. I replaced links with the shell as described in https://issues.tuerantuer.org/browse/INFRA-217
2. After all links have been replaced, the link checker returns some warnings which indicate it is running
3. After some time, an error occurs and no further warnings appear. This indicates that the link validation process has stopped

### Expected Behavior
Errors should either be catched and the LIFO queue should normally be finished. Alternatively, the queue could be persisted, for example in the database, and continued with the next cron job.


### Actual Behavior
One error stops the link check process.

title: Misleading info message in imprint fallback translation form

labels.name: prio: low
labels.description: Not urgent, can be resolved in the distant future.

milestone.title: 23Q1
milestone.description: First quarter 2023

body:
### Describe the Bug
<!-- A clear and concise description of what the bug is. -->
When an imprint translation does not exist, the editor shows a somewhat misleading info message:

> This is not the most recent public revision of this translation. Instead, [revision 1](http://localhost:8000/augsburg/imprint/en/revisions/1) is shown in the apps.

### Steps to Reproduce

1. Create imprint
2. Go to imprint form with non existing translation
4. See info message
5. When clicking on the link, the user is redirected to the form again

### Expected Behavior
<!-- A clear and concise description of what you expected to happen. -->
The info message does not make sense since the linked revision does not exist.
Instead, the message should only be shown when the imprint already exists in this language, but an earlier version is published and the latest changes only exist in draft state.

### Actual Behavior
<!-- A clear and concise description of what actually happened. -->
A misleading info message appears. The link in the message doesn't work.

### Additional Information
<!-- Add any other context (e.g. logs, screenshots, etc.) about the problem here. -->
![Screenshot 2022-10-28 at 18-51-58 Integreat Editorial System](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/16021269/198690758-e1d7450b-a813-4e7e-957b-c71de6ff5457.png)

ToC is no longer being displayed in PDFs. Only the headline "Table of contents" is being shown.

### Steps to Reproduce

1. export page with at least one child page
2. ToC is not being shown

### Expected Behavior

ToC is shown in PDF

### Actual Behavior
<!-- A clear and concise description of what actually happened. -->
Toc is not shown in PDF

<!-- Add any other context (e.g. logs, screenshots, etc.) about the problem here. -->
Apparently this is an unintended consequence of this commit: https://github.com/digitalfabrik/integreat-cms/commit/5e8ecf83dd548b868797686fc57565da44366b19

title: Exclude archived pages from PDF exports

milestone.title: 22Q4
milestone.description: Fourth quarter 2022

body:
### Describe the Bug
Currently, archived pages are still included in PDF exports, even after updating a sibling page to enforce re-export of the PDF.


### Steps to Reproduce

1. export a parent page with children
2. visit the CMS, mark one of these child pages as archived
3. edit and update one of its siblings to ensure the PDF is being regenerated
4. export parent page again
5. archived page is still included in newly generated PDF

### Expected Behavior
Archived pages are never included in PDF exports


### Actual Behavior
Archived pages are included in PDF export of parent


### Additional Information
<!-- Add any other context (e.g. logs, screenshots, etc.) about the problem here. -->

title: Sending feedback for recurring events not working

labels.name: prio: medium
labels.description: Should be scheduled in the forseeable future.

milestone.title: 22Q4
milestone.description: Fourth quarter 2022

body:
### Describe the Bug
<!-- A clear and concise description of what the bug is. -->
The feedback endpoint only accepts event slugs which really exist in the database, so it fails for all recurring events where we generate a bunch of date-specific slugs.

### Steps to Reproduce

1. Create recurring event
2. Retrieve event API endpoint to see which slug the recurring event now has
3. Try to submit feedback about the event with this specific slug

### Expected Behavior
<!-- A clear and concise description of what you expected to happen. -->
The feedback should be submitted

### Actual Behavior
<!-- A clear and concise description of what actually happened. -->
A 404 error occurs: `No matching event found for slug.`

### Additional Information
<!-- Add any other context (e.g. logs, screenshots, etc.) about the problem here. -->
This is similar to https://github.com/digitalfabrik/integreat-cms/issues/1718, but only from the concept, the solution needs to be different.

title: Broken translation status if only minor public versions exist

labels.name: prio: low
labels.description: Not urgent, can be resolved in the distant future.

milestone.title: 22Q4
milestone.description: Fourth quarter 2022

body:
### Describe the Bug
<!-- A clear and concise description of what the bug is. -->
When a POI or Event is published as minor edit, the translation status shows "Fallback translation", which does not make sense.

### Steps to Reproduce

1. Create POI as draft
2. Do not change content and publish - this should create a new versions which is marked as minor edit
3. See translation status in language tab - it is marked as fallback translation

### Expected Behavior
<!-- A clear and concise description of what you expected to happen. -->
The translation should be up to date.
We can achieve this by setting all past versions to public, similar to how we do it for pages:

https://github.com/digitalfabrik/integreat-cms/blob/f90e5aacf3095537a6e19e30d5e2689fccf45a13/integreat_cms/cms/views/pages/page_form_view.py#L342-L350

### Actual Behavior
<!-- A clear and concise description of what actually happened. -->
The translation status is incorrect

### Additional Information
<!-- Add any other context (e.g. logs, screenshots, etc.) about the problem here. -->
![Screenshot 2022-10-24 at 16-45-23 Integreat Redaktionssystem](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/16021269/197555076-01633fd3-49f3-42ac-94c7-093091bb4d72.png)

title: Autocompleting POI address not working for non-staff users

milestone.title: 22Q4
milestone.description: Fourth quarter 2022

body:
### Describe the Bug
<!-- A clear and concise description of what the bug is. -->
At the moment, the auto completion feature introduced in #1744 does only work for staff users.

### Steps to Reproduce

1. Login as non staff user
2. Try to autocomplete POI address
3. See error in JS and Django console

### Expected Behavior
<!-- A clear and concise description of what you expected to happen. -->
The address completion should also work for non staff users.
To solve this, the `region_slug` parameter needs to be passed to the view, even if it's unused.
(Because our [access control](https://github.com/digitalfabrik/integreat-cms/blob/15ce171cc8041bac2d24823e271632db56eaebf1/integreat_cms/core/middleware/access_control_middleware.py#L59-L69) treats all views without the `region_slug` parameter as "staff area" and denies region users to access them.)

### Actual Behavior
<!-- A clear and concise description of what actually happened. -->
A `PermissionDenied` error occurs

### Additional Information
<!-- Add any other context (e.g. logs, screenshots, etc.) about the problem here. -->

title: Hidden languages are listed in fallback translation text

labels.name: prio: medium
labels.description: Should be scheduled in the forseeable future.

milestone.title: 22Q4
milestone.description: Fourth quarter 2022

body:
### Describe the Bug
<!-- A clear and concise description of what the bug is. -->
The fallback text for missing page translations also lists existing public translations in languages which are disabled/hidden.

### Steps to Reproduce

1. Create a page which has no translation in e.g. "ar" but a public translation in "fa"
2. Mark "fa" as "not visible in app"
3. Request API for language "ar"
4. See fallback text which lists the option for "fa"

### Expected Behavior
<!-- A clear and concise description of what you expected to happen. -->
Hidden and disabled languages should not be listed in the fallback translations

### Actual Behavior
<!-- A clear and concise description of what actually happened. -->
They are listed if the translations itself are public

### Additional Information
<!-- Add any other context (e.g. logs, screenshots, etc.) about the problem here. -->
Maybe this also has implications in other places of the cms - e.g. available languages in the API or in the sitemap. Maybe we should exclude these languages in the `prefetch_public_translations()` queryset method?

title: Internal server error when SUMM.AI API returns empty result

labels.description: Should be scheduled in the forseeable future.

body:
### Describe the Bug When the SUMM.API returns an empty result for a specific paragraph, e.g. because it only contains special characters, an internal server error occurs. ### Steps to Reproduce 1. Create a page with a paragraph which only consists of special characters, e.g. `

_____________

` 2. Try to translate the page into Easy German 3. See error ### Expected Behavior The page should be translated and the original content should be used instead of the empty string returned by SUMM.AI ### Actual Behavior An `IndexError: list index out of range` occurs ### Additional Information The problem is that `"".splitlines()` returns an empty list and not `[""]` as I thought it would.

title: Images not line breaking in PDF export

labels.name: prio: low
labels.description: Not urgent, can be resolved in the distant future.

milestone.title: 22Q4
milestone.description: Fourth quarter 2022

body:
### Describe the Bug
<!-- A clear and concise description of what the bug is. -->
When images are placed next to each other, they break into the next line in both the WYSIWYG as well as the webapp.
In the PDF export however, they do not and just overflow the visible page.

### Steps to Reproduce

1. Insert two images next to each other and increase their size
2. Export to PDF

### Expected Behavior
<!-- A clear and concise description of what you expected to happen. -->
The images should both be visible, so break into the next line instead of overflowing

### Actual Behavior
<!-- A clear and concise description of what actually happened. -->
The images overflow

### Additional Information
<!-- Add any other context (e.g. logs, screenshots, etc.) about the problem here. -->

See e.g. https://webnext.integreat.app/testumgebung/de/screenreader  - when converting this page to PDF, the images overflow on the right.

Originally reported in #1499

title: Deleting regions not possible if media library has nested structure

milestone.title: 22Q4
milestone.description: Fourth quarter 2022

body:
### Describe the Bug
<!-- A clear and concise description of what the bug is. -->
Normally, media files and directories are [cascade](https://github.com/digitalfabrik/integreat-cms/blob/a10d0b86986d3bce9cf0a1e981a44a4e38333eea/integreat_cms/cms/models/media/media_file.py#L135) [deleted](https://github.com/digitalfabrik/integreat-cms/blob/a10d0b86986d3bce9cf0a1e981a44a4e38333eea/integreat_cms/cms/models/media/directory.py#L21) when regions are deleted.
However, this fails if the protection rules between media files and directories prevent the cascade deletion.


### Steps to Reproduce

1. Create nested directory structure with media elements in subfolders
2. Try to delete region
3. See error

### Expected Behavior
<!-- A clear and concise description of what you expected to happen. -->
The region should be deleted and all media elements and directories with it.
This can either be achieved by deleting them in the correct order (by deleting the sub-folders and elements first) or removing the protected relationship by setting `parent = None` on all directories and `parent_directory = None` on all media files before deleting.

### Actual Behavior
<!-- A clear and concise description of what actually happened. -->
A `ProtectedError` occurs

### Additional Information
<!-- Add any other context (e.g. logs, screenshots, etc.) about the problem here. -->

title: CircleCI cache of virtual environment outdated

labels.description: Not urgent, can be resolved in the distant future.

body:
### Describe the Bug
<!-- A clear and concise description of what the bug is. -->
After a specific time, the CircleCI cache does not work the way we expect it to.

### Steps to Reproduce

1. Do not update the Pipfile.lock for a while
2. See `FileNotFoundError`s in CircleCI

### Expected Behavior
<!-- A clear and concise description of what you expected to happen. -->
When CircleCI's cache is invalid, it should not be used.

### Actual Behavior
<!-- A clear and concise description of what actually happened. -->
Somehow, CircleCI thinks the cache exists, but the restored files do not contain the required executables.
The check here:
https://github.com/digitalfabrik/integreat-cms/blob/947d227efc57b52d3a2269bfe0e40d8e36248c16/.circleci/config.yml#L18
returns `true`, so CirleCI does restore something (the directory `.venv`), but it does not restore its contents.

### Additional Information
<!-- Add any other context (e.g. logs, screenshots, etc.) about the problem here. -->
Maybe it's already sufficient to change 
```
if [[ -d ".venv" ]]; then
```
```
if [[ -x ".venv/bin/integreat-cms-cli" ]]; then
```
Edit: No, this does not help, see 1ae628d41a85738ebc4758c1a287a5272b4e4dbf and [this build](https://app.circleci.com/pipelines/github/digitalfabrik/integreat-cms/5509/workflows/50614f95-d8f5-4c64-9921-c59f7e5e0438/jobs/48429).

title: Region form locked if SUMM.AI incorrectly enabled

labels.name: prio: low
labels.description: Not urgent, can be resolved in the distant future.

milestone.title: 22Q4
milestone.description: Fourth quarter 2022

body:
### Describe the Bug
<!-- A clear and concise description of what the bug is. -->
There seems to be a small issue with the summ.ai and hix fields in the region form, because if one of these fields is enabled and then the summ.ai api or the textlab api get disabled, it becomes impossible to change any value in the region form. 
This is because the values are required to be set to `False` if the apis are not enabled, however it is impossible to change these values to False.

### Steps to Reproduce
1. Enabled Textlab api 
2. Enable Hix for a region
3. Disable Textlab api
4. Try to change any value in the region form for this region

### Expected Behavior
<!-- A clear and concise description of what you expected to happen. -->
No error message shows up

### Actual Behavior
<!-- A clear and concise description of what actually happened. -->
An error message shows up and the changes in the form don't get applied

### Additional Information
<!-- Add any other context (e.g. logs, screenshots, etc.) about the problem here. -->

title: Event validation throws `KeyError` when dates are invalid

body:
### Describe the Bug
<!-- A clear and concise description of what the bug is. -->
When the event form is submitted without an invalid start or end date, the form throws an internal server error instead of showing an informative error message.

### Steps to Reproduce

Not sure how to reproduce this, one way to simulate it would be to remove the `required` html attribute in the browser's dev tools and submit the form.

### Expected Behavior
<!-- A clear and concise description of what you expected to happen. -->
There should be an informative error message, e.g. "start date is missing" or "start date: xyz is an invalid date format" or similar... This usually happens in Django by default, but in this case the custom `clean()` method breaks the default validation.

<!-- A clear and concise description of what actually happened. -->
An internal server error is thrown (`KeyError: 'end_date'`)

### Additional Information

This is a similar problem like #1656.

title: Incorrect text when saving user whose name already exists

labels.name: prio: low
labels.description: Not urgent, can be resolved in the distant future.

milestone.title: 22Q4
milestone.description: Fourth quarter 2022

body:
### Describe the Bug
When creating a user whose name already exists, the system still displays the message that the activation of the account is outstanding - which is incorrect, since the account was never created

### Steps to Reproduce

1. Go to 'Any region'
2. Click on 'users'

title: Push news translations in main language not sent

milestone.title: 22Q4
milestone.description: Fourth quarter 2022

body:
### Describe the Bug
When a push notification is sent with the mode "Use main language if no translation is available", no translations beside the main language get sent.


### Steps to Reproduce

1. Go to New
2. Enter a notification text and title in the main language
3. Select the "Use main language if no translation is available" mode and send the notification
4. Look into the log file and observe that only one notifications (main language) has been sent, but no other translations

### Expected Behavior
Notifications in all translations should be sent.


### Actual Behavior
Because the form for all other translations is empty, no translation object is being created. However, during the sending process, the [`load_secondary_pnts` method](https://github.com/digitalfabrik/integreat-cms/blob/develop/integreat_cms/cms/views/push_notifications/push_notification_sender.py#L59) iterates over all existing translations. Therefore, no additional notification besides the main translation is being sent.

### Solution
Iterate over all language tree nodes of the region, then check for an existing translation. If no translation exists, create a new PN translation and save the text to the database as well.

Changing to the second page while the list is filtered should lead to the second page of the filtered results, not to the second page of the unfiltered list.

The filters are reset

### Additional Information
<!-- Add any other context (e.g. logs, screenshots, etc.) about the problem here. -->
Probably, we should change our filter forms to GET-requests and keep these parameters when changing the pagination page

title: Hide links on archived pages in broken link checker

milestone.title: 23Q1
milestone.description: First quarter 2023

body:
### Motivation
<!-- A clear and concise description of what the motivation for the new feature is, and what problem it is solving. -->
When broken links are on archived pages, they are less meaningful and can be ignored.

### Proposed Solution
<!-- A clear and concise description of the feature you would like to add, and how it solves the motivating problem. -->
Remove links on archived pages from the broken link checker. We have to evaluate which of the following is more reasonable and efficient:
1. Leave the link objects in the database but filter them in the database query and do not show them in the list
2. Whenever a page is archived, delete all corresponding link objects. On restoring, we have to call save() on the page translations as well to make sure the links are being created again.

### Alternatives
<!-- A clear and concise description of any alternative solutions or features you've considered, and why you're proposed solution is better. -->


### Additional Context
<!-- Add any other information or screenshots about the feature request here. -->

title: Setting an event/location to draft noes not change older versions

milestone.title: 22Q2
milestone.description: Second quarter 2022

body:
### Describe the Bug
<!-- A clear and concise description of what the bug is. -->
When an event/location is saved as draft, only the latest version is marked as "draft" and older public versions are still delivered via the API

### Steps to Reproduce

1. Publish event
2. Change the content and save as draft

### Expected Behavior
<!-- A clear and concise description of what you expected to happen. -->
The event should not be delivered at all - since the status is now "draft"

### Actual Behavior
<!-- A clear and concise description of what actually happened. -->
The old published version is delivered

### Additional Information
<!-- Add any other context (e.g. logs, screenshots, etc.) about the problem here. -->
We already solved this for pages (all past versions need to be stored as draft when an event is stored as draft) and also need to fix this for events and pois.
Since changing all past versions to draft also means that users without publishing permissions could un-publish events/locations, we have to repeat the fixes for #1445 for events/locations as well.

body:
### Describe the Bug

A page with an archived ref node cannot be saved in the page form

Not completely sure how to reproduce this. The tree library has its own "algorithm" to determine the reference node of each node - this is the left neighbour most of the time I think. When this page is pre-selected in the ref-node-field, but it's missing from the form choices (because it's archived), the form throws an error.

The page should be saveable no matter whether a sibling is archived

The ref node field is not recognized as valid choice

### Proposed Solution

User roles who can only change pages and not publish pages should only have the permission to store something as "in review" and not as draft (which also affects past public versions)

title: Clone region copies API token

labels.name: prio: medium
labels.description: Should be scheduled in the forseeable future.

milestone.title: Migration
milestone.description: Get the CMS ready for migrating the Integreat platform

body:
### Describe the Bug
When a region is cloned the  access token for the push page content API endpoint is cloned as well. This is a leak of information as users of the newly cloned region can use this token to push content to the source region.


### Steps to Reproduce

1. Edit a page and set the "API access token"
2. Clone the region
3. Open the page in the cloned region and look at the token.

### Expected Behavior
API access tokens should be cleared after cloning.


### Actual Behavior
API access tokens are cloned along all other page properties.


### Additional Information
Should we reserve a CVE? :joy_cat:

title: All headings are shown in PDF TOC

milestone.title: 22Q2
milestone.description: Second quarter 2022

body:
### Describe the Bug
<!-- A clear and concise description of what the bug is. -->
When PDFs are exported, all headings from `<h1>` to `<h6>` are listed in the table of contents.
Instead, we should only list `<h1>` which originated from real page titles.

### Steps to Reproduce

1. Create page with several sub-headings
2. Export PDF

### Expected Behavior
<!-- A clear and concise description of what you expected to happen. -->
The table of contents should list all pages in the export - not all sub-headings in all pages.

### Actual Behavior
<!-- A clear and concise description of what actually happened. -->
All sub-headings are contained in the TOC as well

### Additional Information
<!-- Add any other context (e.g. logs, screenshots, etc.) about the problem here. -->
I'm not sure whether there is a pretty way to solve this - our library just takes all headings, [see docs](https://xhtml2pdf.readthedocs.io/en/latest/reference.html#table-of-contents).
I see two workarounds for this:
1. Hide the additional levels in the TOC via CSS (preferred)
2. Convert all headings to generic `<div>`s during PDF export and style them the way headings normally look

title: Broken links listed multiple times in broken link checker

labels.name: prio: medium
labels.description: Should be scheduled in the forseeable future.

milestone.title: Migration
milestone.description: Get the CMS ready for migrating the Integreat platform

body:
### Describe the Bug
<!-- A clear and concise description of what the bug is. -->
When the same link appears in multiple places (e.g. in translations of different languages of the same page), it is listed multiple times in the broken link checker.

### Steps to Reproduce

1. Create two objects with the same broken links, e.g. two translations in different languages
2. Go to broken link checker

### Expected Behavior
<!-- A clear and concise description of what you expected to happen. -->
Each broken link should only be listed once. Additionally to the first source of the link, maybe we should list the number of objects this link appears in.

### Actual Behavior
<!-- A clear and concise description of what actually happened. -->
The link is listed multiple times

### Additional Information
<!-- Add any other context (e.g. logs, screenshots, etc.) about the problem here. -->
The linkcheck app already has a de-duplication algorithm by using the intermediate `Url` model which could be used to create the broken link list instead of the `Link` model.

title: CSS cached after change

labels.name: prio: low
labels.description: Not urgent, can be resolved in the distant future.

milestone.title: Migration
milestone.description: Get the CMS ready for migrating the Integreat platform

body:
### Describe the Bug
<!-- A clear and concise description of what the bug is. -->
While our JS-code is bundled to a file which contains the hash of its content, we do not have the same workflow for our css files.
So whenver we change something in the css files, the users might still have an old copy of the css file in their cache.

### Steps to Reproduce

See e.g. html source code:

```
<script src="/static/main.98399dbf796c38c23dbd.js" ></script>
<link href="/static/main.css" rel="stylesheet" />
```

### Expected Behavior
<!-- A clear and concise description of what you expected to happen. -->
We should add the same hash-based-filename for css files like for js files

### Actual Behavior
<!-- A clear and concise description of what actually happened. -->
The css filename does not change when its content does

### Additional Information
<!-- Add any other context (e.g. logs, screenshots, etc.) about the problem here. -->

body:
### Describe the Bug
<!-- A clear and concise description of what the bug is. -->
We use the `lft` field of the MPTT model to convert them to `order` fields which is used by the app.
However, on the root level this does not work, because all root pages have the same `lft` values.

### Steps to Reproduce

Access API and inspect root pages

### Expected Behavior
<!-- A clear and concise description of what you expected to happen. -->
The root pages should be ordered by their tree ids

### Actual Behavior
<!-- A clear and concise description of what actually happened. -->
All root pages have the `order` field `1` because it's their `lft` value

title: PDF documents not downloadable

milestone.title: Migration
milestone.description: Get the CMS ready for migrating the Integreat platform

body:
### Describe the Bug
<!-- A clear and concise description of what the bug is. -->
When a PDF is exported from the page tree, the PDF is correctly generated but cannot be downloaded on all browsers.
Probably this has to do with the fact that the PDF is generated with a POST-view, but if the same url is requested via GET, the export does not work.

One solution could be to store PDFs in a directory that is served by the Apache server and just redirect to the PDF url after generating it instead of directly serving it.

### Steps to Reproduce

1. Go to page tree
2. Export pages as PDF
3. Try do download exported PDF

### Expected Behavior
<!-- A clear and concise description of what you expected to happen. -->
In firefox, everything works as expected: The desired location ca be selected and the file is downlaoded

### Actual Behavior
<!-- A clear and concise description of what actually happened. -->
In Chrome and Opera, a "Network Error" occurs

### Additional Information
<!-- Add any other context (e.g. logs, screenshots, etc.) about the problem here. -->
Opera:

![Image Pasted at 2022-4-11 15-15](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/16021269/162755647-4989c051-71e0-4cbb-823c-246f02095d12.png)

Chromium:

title: Content in tinymce is reset before submitting

milestone.title: Migration
milestone.description: Get the CMS ready for migrating the Integreat platform

body:
### Describe the Bug
<!-- A clear and concise description of what the bug is. -->
When editing a page, the changes are reverted just before the form is submitted.

### Steps to Reproduce

1. Go to a page form
2. Change something
3. Save changes

### Expected Behavior
<!-- A clear and concise description of what you expected to happen. -->
The changes should be saved

### Actual Behavior
<!-- A clear and concise description of what actually happened. -->
The changes are not saved, instead the old content is still present.

### Additional Information
<!-- Add any other context (e.g. logs, screenshots, etc.) about the problem here. -->
It seems like this is a client-side problem: The old content is submitted with the form, even when changes are made.

title: Broken link checker only lists links in default translations

labels.name: prio: medium
labels.description: Should be scheduled in the forseeable future.

milestone.title: Migration
milestone.description: Get the CMS ready for migrating the Integreat platform

body:
### Describe the Bug
<!-- A clear and concise description of what the bug is. -->
The broken link checker does not show broken links in other language than the region's default language

### Steps to Reproduce

1. Go to page tree
2. Insert url in translation which is not in the default language
3. Go to link checker

### Expected Behavior
<!-- A clear and concise description of what you expected to happen. -->
The URL should be visible in the broken link checker, even when it's not in the region's default language

### Actual Behavior
<!-- A clear and concise description of what actually happened. -->
Only links in the default language are listed

### Additional Information
<!-- Add any other context (e.g. logs, screenshots, etc.) about the problem here. -->

Probably it's sufficient to replace `.distinct("page")` with `.distinct("page", "language")` etc. here: https://github.com/digitalfabrik/integreat-cms/blob/7072b555d58b7cf2ab87e82401052d7059ac1428/integreat_cms/cms/utils/filter_links.py#L21

labels.description: Should be scheduled in the forseeable future.

milestone.title: Migration
milestone.description: Get the CMS ready for migrating the Integreat platform

body:
### Describe the Bug
In Malte somehow the tree_id of a subpage got manually changed to another id when saving a new translation: The page with id 3240 had the tree id 417 and its parent 3239 had the tree id 418. I now manually assigned tree id 418 to the subpage and hope that it fixes the problem for now. But we have to investigate how this could happen.

title: `last_updated` field of translations incorrect when cloning regions

labels.name: prio: medium
labels.description: Should be scheduled in the forseeable future.

milestone.title: Migration
milestone.description: Get the CMS ready for migrating the Integreat platform

body:
### Describe the Bug
<!-- A clear and concise description of what the bug is. -->
When cloning regions, the `last_updated` field of translations is incorrectly marked as the time when the region was cloned.
This is problematic because it destroys the editing history and translation status of interdependent translations.

### Steps to Reproduce

1. Clone region
2. Go to page tree
3. See incorrect dates

### Expected Behavior
<!-- A clear and concise description of what you expected to happen. -->
The dates should be preserved

### Actual Behavior
<!-- A clear and concise description of what actually happened. -->
The dates are set to the current time

title: Push notifications ordered incorrectly

labels.name: prio: medium
labels.description: Should be scheduled in the forseeable future.

milestone.title: Migration
milestone.description: Get the CMS ready for migrating the Integreat platform

body:
### Describe the Bug
<!-- A clear and concise description of what the bug is. -->
In both the push notification list and the API, the results are ordered incorrectly.

### Steps to Reproduce

1. Go to push notifications
2. See order

### Expected Behavior
<!-- A clear and concise description of what you expected to happen. -->

- In the push notification list, the result is ordered descending by creation date
- In the push notification API, the result is ordered by the push notification id

### Actual Behavior
<!-- A clear and concise description of what actually happened. -->

- In the push notification list, the result should be ordered by the last updated date of the translation, and ascending instead of descending
- In the push notification API, the result should be ordered by the timestamp (which should be the last updated date instead of the sent date)

### Additional Information
<!-- Add any other context (e.g. logs, screenshots, etc.) about the problem here. -->

title: Page tree broken after search is cleared

milestone.title: Migration
milestone.description: Get the CMS ready for migrating the Integreat platform

body:
### Describe the Bug
<!-- A clear and concise description of what the bug is. -->
When the search form in the page tree is cleared, all pages are expanded by default, but the collapsing/expanding does not work as expected.

Maybe the source of the bug is the same as #1179 and it's not a browser caching problem after all? If so, maybe fixing this also fixes #1245 when we enable the browser cache again after the back-button.

### Steps to Reproduce

1. Go to the page tree
2. Enter something into the seach bar and submit
3. Clear the search via the "x"
4. See broken page tree

### Expected Behavior
<!-- A clear and concise description of what you expected to happen. -->
The page tree should be fully collapsed and expanding should work normal

### Actual Behavior
<!-- A clear and concise description of what actually happened. -->
Everything is expanded and the tree becomes weird on toggling subpages

### Additional Information
<!-- Add any other context (e.g. logs, screenshots, etc.) about the problem here. -->

E.g. the following subtree:

![Screenshot 2022-03-15 at 16-46-48 Integreat Redaktionssystem](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/16021269/158416817-ab6c7c4a-ba81-4e11-be24-68cff46930c1.png)

Toggling the subpages only hides the middle level and the leaf pages are still visible

![Screenshot 2022-03-15 at 16-46-58 Integreat Redaktionssystem](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/16021269/158416811-f7467cdb-c09b-45d8-9d34-225e00864c5a.png)

title: Push notifications can be sent multiple times

milestone.title: Migration
milestone.description: Get the CMS ready for migrating the Integreat platform

body:
### Describe the Bug
<!-- A clear and concise description of what the bug is. -->
It should not be possible to send push notifications multiple times to prevent the accidental re-sending of news.
Instead, only the "save" button should be enabled which can be used to update the messages that are delivered via the API endpoint.

### Steps to Reproduce

1. Go to News
2. Send new push notification
3. Send again

### Expected Behavior
<!-- A clear and concise description of what you expected to happen. -->
The news should only be sent the first time and only saved on all subsequent submissions

### Actual Behavior
<!-- A clear and concise description of what actually happened. -->
The news is sent twice

milestone.description: Get the CMS ready for migrating the Integreat platform

body:
### Describe the Bug
The development release pipeline is currently broken due to a problem with detecting the next version.

Solution: we use a different naming pattern. I'd suggest one of the following:
- `YYYY.MM-COMMIT_HASH`
- `YYYY.MM-COMMIT_NUM` (`COMMIT_NUM` is the number of the commit since first commit)

### Steps to Reproduce

1. Merge a PR to develop

### Expected Behavior
Create a beta release.

### Actual Behavior
The script to detect the next version runs in a circle.


### Additional Information
<!-- Add any other context (e.g. logs, screenshots, etc.) about the problem here. -->

title: Issue with Cache in children endpoint

milestone.title: Migration
milestone.description: Get the CMS ready for migrating the Integreat platform

body:
**This issue needs further investigation/testing**. For Malte the cache is currently disabled and the performance is acceptable. The priority of this issue depends on the performance of the migrated Integreat CMS.

### Describe the Bug
When calling random pages we sometimes get the following stack trace:
```
Feb 21 22:53:01 ERROR   django.request - Internal Server Error: /leakarlsruhefelsstrasse/de/wp-json/extensions/v3/children/
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/opt/integreat-cms/.venv/lib/python3.9/site-packages/django/core/handlers/exception.py", line 47, in inner
    response = get_response(request)
  File "/opt/integreat-cms/.venv/lib/python3.9/site-packages/django/core/handlers/base.py", line 181, in _get_response
    response = wrapped_callback(request, *callback_args, **callback_kwargs)
  File "/opt/integreat-cms/.venv/lib/python3.9/site-packages/integreat_cms/api/decorators.py", line 178, in wrap
    return func(request, *args, **kwargs)
  File "/opt/integreat-cms/.venv/lib/python3.9/site-packages/integreat_cms/api/decorators.py", line 124, in wrap
    return function(request, *args, **kwargs)
  File "/opt/integreat-cms/.venv/lib/python3.9/site-packages/integreat_cms/api/v3/pages.py", line 205, in children
    result.append(transform_page(public_translation))
  File "/opt/integreat-cms/.venv/lib/python3.9/site-packages/integreat_cms/api/v3/pages.py", line 22, in transform_page
    parent_page = page_translation.page.cached_parent
  File "/opt/integreat-cms/.venv/lib/python3.9/site-packages/django/utils/functional.py", line 48, in __get__
    res = instance.__dict__[self.name] = self.func(instance)
  File "/opt/integreat-cms/.venv/lib/python3.9/site-packages/integreat_cms/cms/models/abstract_tree_node.py", line 210, in cached_parent
    return self.get_cached_ancestors()[-1]
IndexError: list index out of range
```
This trace persists until the cache is flushed.

### Steps to Reproduce

Happens randomly. Visit pages until it happens.

For the time being we could use a simple filter instead of a cache operation in https://github.com/digitalfabrik/integreat-cms/blob/develop/integreat_cms/api/v3/pages.py#L231

title: Feedback returns 405 Method Not Allowed

milestone.title: Stable release
milestone.description: All non-critical features must be finished until this milestone. If they are not finished, introduction of the new CMS will be postponed.

body:
### Describe the Bug
When sending feedback, for example about a page or search result, the API returns a `405 Method Not Allowed`


### Steps to Reproduce

1. Go to https://webnext.malte-app.de
2. Open the JS console and enter `window.localStorage.setItem('api-url', 'https://malte-test.tuerantuer.org');`
3. Send feedback
4. Look into the network developer tool or log file

### Expected Behavior
The API should say 200 OK and save the feedback.


### Actual Behavior
```
Feb 16 16:53:47 WARNING django.request - Method Not Allowed: /baddoberan/de/wp-json/extensions/v3/feedback/search/
```

title: Page tree broken after searching and going back

labels.name: prio: medium
labels.description: Should be scheduled in the forseeable future.

milestone.title: Stable release
milestone.description: All non-critical features must be finished until this milestone. If they are not finished, introduction of the new CMS will be postponed.

body:
### Describe the Bug
When using the back button of the browser after searching, the page tree is expanded. After that, the collapsing function is broken.

Can we tell the browser to reload the full page after using the back button? However, it would be the best solution to actually keep the status of the tree after using the back button.

~~This could be related to #1131~~

title: Git release tag message malformed

labels.name: prio: low
labels.description: Not urgent, can be resolved in the distant future.

milestone.title: Stable release
milestone.description: All non-critical features must be finished until this milestone. If they are not finished, introduction of the new CMS will be postponed.

body:
### Describe the Bug
<!-- A clear and concise description of what the bug is. -->
Our release workflow parses the changelog and puts it as git tag message.
Unfortunately, this cannot contain markdown, but only plain text.

### Expected Behavior
<!-- A clear and concise description of what you expected to happen. -->
Since issue links are automatically converted, I suggest to convert each line
`* [ [#num](link) ] description` to
`* [ link ] description`
before the git tag is created.
The format of the changelog itself should remain the same, since it's used in other places that expect markdown syntax.

Additionally, there is a spacing between the first and the second line, so I suggest to add an additional subject line before the normal changelog entries.
### Actual Behavior
<!-- A clear and concise description of what actually happened. -->
See https://github.com/digitalfabrik/integreat-cms/tags:
![Screenshot 2022-02-15 at 12-18-22 digitalfabrik integreat-cms New content management back end for the Integreat App - a mul](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/16021269/154051761-f4ceb170-82d0-4ce5-a3e9-a9b3d9e018a3.png)


### Additional Information
<!-- Add any other context (e.g. logs, screenshots, etc.) about the problem here. -->
These are the lines where we need to change the format of the git tag:
https://github.com/digitalfabrik/integreat-cms/blob/8391dd4e3a53758c3b7851bfaf76073f3859a31c/.circleci/config.yml#L307-L309

title: Selecting subpages does not activate the bulk action button

labels.name: prio: medium
labels.description: Should be scheduled in the forseeable future.

milestone.title: Stable release
milestone.description: All non-critical features must be finished until this milestone. If they are not finished, introduction of the new CMS will be postponed.

body:
### Describe the Bug
<!-- A clear and concise description of what the bug is. -->
On the page tree, only root pages activate the bulk action button and subpages do not.
This means, that at the moment, bulk actions can only be performed when at least one root page is selected as well.

### Steps to Reproduce

1. Go to the page tree
2. Expand a root page
3. Select a subpage
4. Select a bulk action, e.g. PDF export

### Expected Behavior
<!-- A clear and concise description of what you expected to happen. -->
The bulk action button should now be active

### Actual Behavior
<!-- A clear and concise description of what actually happened. -->
The button is still disabled

### Additional Information
<!-- Add any other context (e.g. logs, screenshots, etc.) about the problem here. -->
This bug was probably introduced with the change to ajax page tree fetching, maybe the event handlers have to be renewed after the subpages are loaded.

title: Double quotes break mattermost release notification

labels.name: prio: medium
labels.description: Should be scheduled in the forseeable future.

milestone.title: 22Q4
milestone.description: Fourth quarter 2022

body:
### Describe the Bug
<!-- A clear and concise description of what the bug is. -->
When the changelog contains double qoutes, the release notification via mattermost doesn't work.

### Steps to Reproduce 
Please don't reproduce this intentionally.

This happened on release [2022.2.0-beta](https://github.com/digitalfabrik/integreat-cms/releases/tag/2022.2.0-beta), the culprit being this line:
https://github.com/digitalfabrik/integreat-cms/blame/develop/CHANGELOG.md#L26
Which is parsed into the mattermost message here:
https://github.com/digitalfabrik/integreat-cms/blob/d51bfd142486171a77fe0201150ae02c420048e0/.circleci/config.yml#L347-L353
The message is inside JSON, which is inside the curl data string, so already the wrapper around this message contains escaped quotes and normal escaped quotes would break the JSON structure.

### Expected Behavior
<!-- A clear and concise description of what you expected to happen. -->
It should be possible to use double quotes in the CHANGELOG. Either escape them properly or convert them to single quotes before posting to mattermost. 

### Actual Behavior
<!-- A clear and concise description of what actually happened. -->
The notify job fails, see https://app.circleci.com/pipelines/github/digitalfabrik/integreat-cms/3446/workflows/69008f05-e8d9-4be7-a187-0b106a44a2b2/jobs/27267

### Additional Information
<!-- Add any other context (e.g. logs, screenshots, etc.) about the problem here. -->

Alternatively, we can also add a check that prohibit double quotes in the changelog.

title: Content paragraph handling

milestone.title: Stable release
milestone.description: All non-critical features must be finished until this milestone. If they are not finished, introduction of the new CMS will be postponed.

body:
### Describe the Bug WordPress transforms new lines (`\n`) to paragraphs when serving the content in the API. Also, the WordPress editor renders new lines, while Django ignores them. This is what it looks like in Django and the web app: ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/15197000/150677831-b89926d0-eeb9-46c9-bf50-6a6819c4db9c.png) ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/15197000/150677840-6a2a1706-fcfd-49df-a876-93ea06893b79.png) However, it should look like this: ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/15197000/150677857-64790c2d-502c-49e6-a855-f3c18a3fa90e.png) ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/15197000/150677887-8ad5f5d9-2bb5-424b-aeeb-1fd8f547cf2c.png) The question we need to answer is: do we want to transform line breaks into paragraphs during migration or do we want to implement the WP behavior in the Integreat CMS? The rule for replacing the new lines would probably look like this: ```python content = "

" + content.replace("\r\n\r\n", "

").replace("\r\n", "
") + "

" ``` This should work as WordPress ends tags at each new paragraph and opens new tags in the next, for example when 2 paragraphs are marked as bold.
