title: SVGs not supported by PDF library

labels.name: prio: medium
labels.description: Should be scheduled in the forseeable future.

milestone.title: Migration
milestone.description: Get the CMS ready for migrating the Integreat platform

body:
### Describe the Bug At the moment, we use svg images as icons and the media export from wordpress also might contain svg images. These images are not included in PDFs which are generated with xhtml2pdf. The corresponding issue is: https://github.com/xhtml2pdf/xhtml2pdf/issues/73 Apparently, there is an open PR for it (https://github.com/xhtml2pdf/xhtml2pdf/pull/561), but it shows no recent activity. As solution, I see 3 options: 1. Change our icons to png and convert all svgs to pngs during the media export 2. See what's holding up the upstream process and try support the library maintainers 3. Switch to another PDF library ### Steps to Reproduce 1. Insert SVG into page 2. Convert this page to PDF 3. The image is missing in the PDF ### Expected Behavior The image should be included in the PDF ### Actual Behavior The image is missing and the error `PIL.UnidentifiedImageError: cannot identify image file` appears in the console
Traceback ``` Jan 18 16:23:49 WARNING integreat_cms.cms.utils.pdf_utils - The file 'http://localhost:8000/static/svg/pin.svg' is not inside the static directories '/static/' and '/media/'. Jan 18 16:23:49 INFO django.server - "GET /static/svg/pin.svg HTTP/1.1" 200 781 Jan 18 16:23:49 WARNING xhtml2pdf - Error in handling image '' Traceback (most recent call last): File "/integreat/integreat-cms/.venv/lib/python3.9/site-packages/xhtml2pdf/xhtml2pdf_reportlab.py", line 350, in __init__ self._image = self._read_image(self.fp) File "/integreat/integreat-cms/.venv/lib/python3.9/site-packages/xhtml2pdf/xhtml2pdf_reportlab.py", line 380, in _read_image return PILImage.open(fp) File "/integreat/integreat-cms/.venv/lib/python3.9/site-packages/PIL/Image.py", line 3008, in open raise UnidentifiedImageError( PIL.UnidentifiedImageError: cannot identify image file <_io.BytesIO object at 0x7f04716d3d10> fileName=<_io.BytesIO object at 0x7f04716d3d10> During handling of the above exception, another exception occurred: Traceback (most recent call last): File "/integreat/integreat-cms/.venv/lib/python3.9/site-packages/xhtml2pdf/tags.py", line 344, in start img = PmlImage( File "/integreat/integreat-cms/.venv/lib/python3.9/site-packages/xhtml2pdf/xhtml2pdf_reportlab.py", line 487, in __init__ img = self.getImage() File "/integreat/integreat-cms/.venv/lib/python3.9/site-packages/xhtml2pdf/xhtml2pdf_reportlab.py", line 508, in getImage img = PmlImageReader(six.BytesIO(self._imgdata)) File "/integreat/integreat-cms/.venv/lib/python3.9/site-packages/xhtml2pdf/xhtml2pdf_reportlab.py", line 369, in __init__ raise RuntimeError("{0} {1} {2}".format(et, ev, tb)) RuntimeError: cannot identify image file <_io.BytesIO object at 0x7f04716d3d10> fileName=<_io.BytesIO object at 0x7f04716d3d10> ```
### Additional Information

title: `MultipleObjectsReturned` in page children API endpoint

labels.name: prio: medium
labels.description: Should be scheduled in the forseeable future.

milestone.title: Stable release
milestone.description: All non-critical features must be finished until this milestone. If they are not finished, introduction of the new CMS will be postponed.

body:
### Describe the Bug
<!-- A clear and concise description of what the bug is. -->
When the children of a page with more than one version with the same slug are requested via the `url` parameter, the error `MultipleObjectsReturned` gets thrown.

### Steps to Reproduce

1. Go to the region Augsbug
2. Create at least one additional version of the Willkommen page with the same slug
3. Open http://localhost:8000/api/augsburg/de/children?url=willkommen
4. See error

### Expected Behavior
<!-- A clear and concise description of what you expected to happen. -->
The children of the page should be returned

### Actual Behavior
<!-- A clear and concise description of what actually happened. -->
The following error appears:
```
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/opt/integreat-cms/.venv/lib/python3.8/site-packages/django/core/handlers/exception.py", line 47, in inner
    response = get_response(request)
  File "/opt/integreat-cms/.venv/lib/python3.8/site-packages/django/core/handlers/base.py", line 181, in _get_response
    response = wrapped_callback(request, *callback_args, **callback_kwargs)
  File "/opt/integreat-cms/.venv/lib/python3.8/site-packages/integreat_cms/api/decorators.py", line 112, in wrap
    return function(request, *args, **kwargs)
  File "/opt/integreat-cms/.venv/lib/python3.8/site-packages/integreat_cms/api/v3/pages.py", line 184, in children
    root_pages = [get_single_page(request, language_slug)]
  File "/opt/integreat-cms/.venv/lib/python3.8/site-packages/integreat_cms/api/v3/pages.py", line 116, in get_single_page
    page = get_object_or_404(
  File "/opt/integreat-cms/.venv/lib/python3.8/site-packages/django/shortcuts.py", line 76, in get_object_or_404
    return queryset.get(*args, **kwargs)
  File "/opt/integreat-cms/.venv/lib/python3.8/site-packages/django/db/models/manager.py", line 85, in manager_method
    return getattr(self.get_queryset(), name)(*args, **kwargs)
  File "/opt/integreat-cms/.venv/lib/python3.8/site-packages/cacheops/query.py", line 351, in get
    return qs._no_monkey.get(qs, *args, **kwargs)
  File "/opt/integreat-cms/.venv/lib/python3.8/site-packages/django/db/models/query.py", line 439, in get
    raise self.model.MultipleObjectsReturned(
integreat_cms.cms.models.pages.page.Page.MultipleObjectsReturned: get() returned more than one Page -- it returned more than 20!
```

### Additional Information
<!-- Add any other context (e.g. logs, screenshots, etc.) about the problem here. -->

The problem is that the `get_object_or_404()` doesn't work with reverse foreign keys, because the same element might be in the queryset multiple times, so this is the culprit:
https://github.com/digitalfabrik/integreat-cms/blob/810bd2f3be861db0148a5e0410b5878ee59bfa17/integreat_cms/api/v3/pages.py#L116-L120
We probably need to add a `distinct()` here and throw an `Http404` manually without the shortcut method.

title: Select all subpages when checking parent page

body:
### Motivation
<!-- A clear and concise description of what the motivation for the new feature is, and what problem it is solving. -->
In the page tree, typically a parent page should include all its subpages for all bulk actions.

### Proposed Solution
<!-- A clear and concise description of the feature you would like to add, and how it solves the motivating problem. -->
When selecting a parent page in the page tree, all its sub-pages should be selected as well. This also applies to de-selecting a page. After that, it should be possible to (de-)select individual subpages without changing the selection status of the parent page.

### Alternatives
<!-- A clear and concise description of any alternative solutions or features you've considered, and why you're proposed solution is better. -->


### Additional Context
<!-- Add any other information or screenshots about the feature request here. -->

Normally, the `creator` field of translations should always have a valid relation to the user model.
However, if a user gets deleted, this field becomes `None`, which is not handled correctly at the moment.

### Actual Behavior
<!-- A clear and concise description of what actually happened. -->

### Expected Behavior
<!-- A clear and concise description of what you expected to happen. -->
- The pages should be duplicated with the same empty creator field

body:
### Describe the Bug
<!-- A clear and concise description of what the bug is. -->
Our language tab design doesn't scale well if the number of languages is increasing or the screen size is small.

![Screenshot 2021-11-23 at 19-22-46 Integreat Redaktionssystem](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/16021269/143082670-1e13a883-2447-4f3b-927c-6450841b0537.png)


### Expected Behavior
<!-- A clear and concise description of what you expected to happen. -->

I see three main problems:
- The "Version" link should not cause the language tabs to float. Instead, we should maybe move it back into the white box to the rest of the form?
- Tabs in the second row should expand until the form-box (so no light blue background should be visible between the tabs and the box). But not sure whether that's doable, since the space underneath is in theory taken by the following flex items...
- If a tab in the top row is selected, it shouldn't have a bottom white border (because this causes it to "melt" into the bottom tab which makes no sense - the idea was that it should "melt" into the box itself). But no idea whether we can safely detect whether a tab is in the top bar or the bottom bar, since it's just one flexbox...

### Actual Behavior
<!-- A clear and concise description of what actually happened. -->
Everything looks weird

### Additional Information
<!-- Add any other context (e.g. logs, screenshots, etc.) about the problem here. -->

body:
### Describe the Bug
<!-- A clear and concise description of what the bug is. -->
Since our change to a custom user model, our page object-specific permissions aren't working anymore.
Apparently, django-rules has problems with this (see https://github.com/dfunckt/django-rules/issues/151).
The biggest problem is that it breaks the normal page permissions, even if page-specific permissions are disabled.

### Steps to Reproduce

1. Create a non-superuser which should have the permissions to edit all pages
2. Login with this user and open a page form

### Expected Behavior
<!-- A clear and concise description of what you expected to happen. -->
The user should be able to edit the page

### Actual Behavior
<!-- A clear and concise description of what actually happened. -->
It's not possible to edit/publish the page and the following messages are shown:
![Screenshot 2021-11-23 at 15-26-35 Integreat Editorial System](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/16021269/143042237-b6db9457-8ebe-403a-8c40-fae64d180c30.png)

### Describe the Bug

title: API: page attributes path and url differ with WordPress

milestone.title: Stable release
milestone.description: All non-critical features must be finished until this milestone. If they are not finished, introduction of the new CMS will be postponed.

body:
### Describe the Bug
https://cms-dev.integreat-app.de/bocholt/en/wp-json/extensions/v3/children?depth=1 and https://cms-dev.integreat-app.de/bocholt/en/wp-json/extensions/v3/children?depth=1 return different content for page / page translation objects. In WordPress, the full URL is returned in `url` and in `path` the full path part of the URL is returned. Django only returns the page slug itself in `path` and `url` is missing the domain and schema.

WordPress:
```
url: "https://cms-dev.integreat-app.de/bocholt/en/corona-virus/"
path: "/bocholt/en/corona-virus/"
```

Django:
```
url: "bocholt/en/information-on-the-corona-virus"
path: "information-on-the-corona-virus"
```

### Expected Behavior
The values in Django need to be the same as in WordPress.

title: Autosave changes unversioned `Page` model

labels.name: prio: low
labels.description: Not urgent, can be resolved in the distant future.

milestone.title: Stable release
milestone.description: All non-critical features must be finished until this milestone. If they are not finished, introduction of the new CMS will be postponed.

body:
### Describe the Bug
<!-- A clear and concise description of what the bug is. -->
When an autosave is triggered, the complete `Page` and `PageTranslation` model instances are saved.
Since just the `PageTranslation` is versioned, this might lead to unexpected changes on public pages.

### Steps to Reproduce

1. Go to a page form
2. Edit something in the content textarea to trigger the tinymce autosave
3. Change some field in the page form, e.g. embed live content
4. Wait for the autosave to get triggered
5. Return without saving

### Expected Behavior
<!-- A clear and concise description of what you expected to happen. -->
All page fields should be unchanged, since they are not versioned and there is no backup of the "public" state. If the page field is exited without saving, the page model instance should be exactly the same as before.

### Actual Behavior
<!-- A clear and concise description of what actually happened. -->
All fields are automatically saved and the page instance is saved as well.

### Additional Information
<!-- Add any other context (e.g. logs, screenshots, etc.) about the problem here. -->
Probably, this can be solved by limiting the `FormData` in [src/frontend/js/forms/autosave.ts](https://github.com/Integreat/integreat-cms/blob/8219586acbb98c681635210d0c45817285a0c13e/src/frontend/js/forms/autosave.ts#L7) so only the fields `slug`, `title` and `text`/`description` are saved.
_Edit:_ Probably not, since this would cause the validation to fail or remove specific values... so maybe we need a completely new view for the autosave?

title: Broken icon widget preview

labels.name: prio: low
labels.description: Not urgent, can be resolved in the distant future.

milestone.title: Stable release
milestone.description: All non-critical features must be finished until this milestone. If they are not finished, introduction of the new CMS will be postponed.

body:
### Describe the Bug
<!-- A clear and concise description of what the bug is. -->
At the moment, we have two problems with the preview of our custom icon widget:

1. If the media library overlay is closed without selecting a file, the preview shows a broken image placeholder.

    **Suggested Solution:**
    Only show the preview when the file is selected, not when the media library overlay is opened.


2. If a PDF file is selected as icon, the following `ValueError` is shown:
    ```
    ValueError at /organizations/1/edit
    
    The 'thumbnail' attribute has no file associated with it.
    ```

    **Suggested Solution:**
    Only make it possible to select images as icons, and not text documents. This may require some changes to the media library (especially the overlay which is used to select the files). Additionally, include a fallback for when the file is an image but has no valid thumbnail. In this case, the actual file should be used for the preview.

title: Menu links not working anymore when media library is opened

milestone.title: Stable release
milestone.description: All non-critical features must be finished until this milestone. If they are not finished, introduction of the new CMS will be postponed.

body:
### Describe the Bug
<!-- A clear and concise description of what the bug is. -->
When the media library is opened, all other links outside the media library are not working anymore and are just interpreted as directory ids for the media library.
E.g., when clicking on the link http://localhost:8000/admin_dashboard/, the preact router catches this URL and actually opens http://localhost:8000/media-library/#/admin_dashboard/, which causes the server error `ValueError: Field 'id' expected a number but got 'admin_dashboard'` and the in the frontend, the error `An error has occurred. Please try again later.` appears.

### Steps to Reproduce

1. Go to the media library
2. Click on any link outside the media library
4. See error

### Expected Behavior
<!-- A clear and concise description of what you expected to happen. -->
Normal links should still work

### Actual Behavior
<!-- A clear and concise description of what actually happened. -->
All links are treated as internal media library links of the preact router

### Additional Information
<!-- Add any other context (e.g. logs, screenshots, etc.) about the problem here. -->

title: Filenames longer than 64 chars not uploadable

labels.name: prio: medium
labels.description: Should be scheduled in the forseeable future.

milestone.title: Stable release
milestone.description: All non-critical features must be finished until this milestone. If they are not finished, introduction of the new CMS will be postponed.

body:
### Describe the Bug
<!-- A clear and concise description of what the bug is. -->
Files with a name of more than 64 characters cannot be uploaded.

### Steps to Reproduce

1. Go to the media library
2. Click on "Upload File"
3. Select a file with a name of 65 characters or more
4. See error

### Expected Behavior
<!-- A clear and concise description of what you expected to happen. -->
Sensible lengths of filenames should be supported, I think at least 255 characters. If the filename is too long, a good error message should indicate the problem to the user.

### Actual Behavior
<!-- A clear and concise description of what actually happened. -->
The message "A network error has occurred. Please try again later." is shown to the user, which is not really what happened.

title: Editor autosave not updating tinymce content

labels.name: prio: medium
labels.description: Should be scheduled in the forseeable future.

milestone.title: Stable release
milestone.description: All non-critical features must be finished until this milestone. If they are not finished, introduction of the new CMS will be postponed.

body:
### Describe the Bug
<!-- A clear and concise description of what the bug is. -->
The tinymce autosave function only submits all form fields except the content field of the tinymce editor.

### Steps to Reproduce

1. Go to a page form
2. Change something
3. Wait for the autosave
4. Look at the debug log what form fields are submitted

### Expected Behavior
<!-- A clear and concise description of what you expected to happen. -->
The content of the tinymce editor should be submitted as `text`/`description` field

### Actual Behavior
<!-- A clear and concise description of what actually happened. -->
The initial value of the content field is submitted, independently from what was entered in the editor

### Additional Information
<!-- Add any other context (e.g. logs, screenshots, etc.) about the problem here. -->

I think this might be because tinymce seems to submit its value into the html textarea field only when the form is submitted via a submit button, not when serialized via FormData. A solution is described e.g. [here](https://stackoverflow.com/questions/2122085/jquery-and-tinymce-textarea-value-doesnt-submit): Add `import tinymce from "tinymce";` to [src/frontend/js/forms/autosave.ts](https://github.com/Integreat/integreat-cms/blob/develop/src/frontend/js/forms/autosave.ts) and insert `tinymce.triggerSave();` before `let formData = new FormData(form);`.

title: Editor autosave not working

labels.name: prio: medium
labels.description: Should be scheduled in the forseeable future.

milestone.title: Stable release
milestone.description: All non-critical features must be finished until this milestone. If they are not finished, introduction of the new CMS will be postponed.

body:
### Describe the Bug
<!-- A clear and concise description of what the bug is. -->
The tinymce autosave functionality does not work as expected. The ajax calls are triggered, but because the form validation fails, the result is not saved.

### Steps to Reproduce

1. Go to a page form
2. Change something
3. Wait for the autosave
4. Reload page to check whether new version is created

### Expected Behavior
<!-- A clear and concise description of what you expected to happen. -->
The autosave should create a new version as draft

### Actual Behavior
<!-- A clear and concise description of what actually happened. -->
No new version is created

### Additional Information
<!-- Add any other context (e.g. logs, screenshots, etc.) about the problem here. -->
Looking at the response of the autosave ajax call, we can find the message "status: This field is required.", because we set the status via the submit buttons and the autosave does not include the submit buttons. So as a quick fix, I would suggest sending a post status in the autosave ajax function in [src/frontend/js/forms/autosave.ts](https://github.com/Integreat/integreat-cms/blob/develop/src/frontend/js/forms/autosave.ts), e.g. by adding the following line:
```
let formData = new FormData(form);
formData.append("submit_draft", "true");
```

body:
### Describe the Bug
<!-- A clear and concise description of what the bug is. -->
The query string for pagination defined in the links of the pagination template has a divergent name to most views that use pagination. The paginators get method also works with empty query strings, but only returns the first page in this case.

### Steps to Reproduce

1. Go to a view that uses pagination like the user lists
2. Add as many user to exceed the number per page
3. Try to proceed to another page than the first
4. All links go back to the first page

### Expected Behavior
<!-- A clear and concise description of what you expected to happen. -->
Browsing between the different pages should be possible

### Actual Behavior
<!-- A clear and concise description of what actually happened. -->
All pagination links route back to the first page

### Additional Information
<!-- Add any other context (e.g. logs, screenshots, etc.) about the problem here. -->
The query string was renamed in the pagination template in accordance to the frameworks default name

title: Adress HTML-Main Tag problem for the IE 11

labels.name: prio: low
labels.description: Not urgent, can be resolved in the distant future.

milestone.title: Stable release
milestone.description: All non-critical features must be finished until this milestone. If they are not finished, introduction of the new CMS will be postponed.

body:
### Describe the Bug
As we are compiling our HTML & CSS down to the IE 11, but not our HTML (I guess, which isn't possible), the `<main>` tag isn't integrated in the IE 11, which results in a lot of overflows.


### Steps to Reproduce

1. Open any page on a IE 11.
2. Take a look at the navbar and the `<main>` content block.

### Additional Information
IE supports the `<main>` tag only partially
![grafik](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/15608678/117445762-60fc2280-af3b-11eb-866c-5687aade154c.png)

See https://stackoverflow.com/questions/35820429/main-element-not-working-in-internet-explorer-11 for a possible solution.

title: Admin menu visible in user settings

labels.name: prio: low
labels.description: Not urgent, can be resolved in the distant future.

milestone.title: Stable release
milestone.description: All non-critical features must be finished until this milestone. If they are not finished, introduction of the new CMS will be postponed.

body:
### Describe the Bug
<!-- A clear and concise description of what the bug is. -->
Since the user settings are region-independent, we didn't include the region parameter in the [user_settings](https://github.com/Integreat/integreat-cms/blob/0d623d97bfd2bc91765fbc3e93c4f37a7f15b0dc/src/cms/urls.py#L258) url.
However, even for non-staff users, this means there are links to the admin dashboard which shouldn't be the case.

### Steps to Reproduce

1. Create a non-staff user
2. Go to the user settings

### Expected Behavior
<!-- A clear and concise description of what you expected to happen. -->
The menu should correspond to one region of the user. Ideally the same region in which the user was before he clicked on the user settings

### Actual Behavior
<!-- A clear and concise description of what actually happened. -->
Even non-staff users are in the network settings

### Additional Information

title: Account activation not CSRF protected

labels.name: prio: medium
labels.description: Should be scheduled in the forseeable future.

milestone.title: Stable release
milestone.description: All non-critical features must be finished until this milestone. If they are not finished, introduction of the new CMS will be postponed.

body:
### Describe the Bug
<!-- A clear and concise description of what the bug is. -->
Currently, the account activation is not CSRF protected, which means that malicious users with inactive accounts could request an account activation by sending a link to an administrator. If he is not carefully and opens the link, an activation email is sent to the user.

### Steps to Reproduce

Copy the "Resend activation email" link from the user table into a new browser tab

### Expected Behavior
<!-- A clear and concise description of what you expected to happen. -->
A CSRF error should appear

### Actual Behavior
<!-- A clear and concise description of what actually happened. -->
The activation mail is sent

### Additional Information
<!-- Add any other context (e.g. logs, screenshots, etc.) about the problem here. -->
This can easily be fixed by making the activation link view only reachable via `POST` and turn the "Resend activation mail" link into a form:

https://github.com/Integreat/integreat-cms/blob/c72f374e78aab800b112abb3d95f3d88c83bf2e3/src/cms/templates/users/admin/list_row.html#L51-L55

title: Password reset tokens can be used for account activation

labels.name: prio: medium
labels.description: Should be scheduled in the forseeable future.

milestone.title: Stable release
milestone.description: All non-critical features must be finished until this milestone. If they are not finished, introduction of the new CMS will be postponed.

body:
### Describe the Bug
<!-- A clear and concise description of what the bug is. -->
The password reset mechanism and the account activation use the [same token generator](https://github.com/django/django/blob/aa4acc164d1247c0de515c959f7b09648b57dc42/django/contrib/auth/tokens.py#L8).
This means, that reset password tokens (which can be requested by the user himself) can be used to activate an account (which should only be possible to initiate by an administrator).
There is a partial protection against this: Inactive accounts cannot reset their passwords. However, since password reset tokens are valid for 3 days by default, it means that tokens generated right before the de-activation of a user can be used to re-activate the account without a possibility to invalidate tokens. So a malicious account could prevent his de-activation by generating reset tokens every 3 days.

### Steps to Reproduce

1. Create active user
2. Generate password reset token for this user (but don't use it yet)
3. Deactivate user by administrator
4. Replace "password_reset" by "activate_account" in the reset url
5. Set a new password and activate the account again with the password reset roken

### Expected Behavior
<!-- A clear and concise description of what you expected to happen. -->
A valid password reset token should not be valid for account activation

### Actual Behavior
<!-- A clear and concise description of what actually happened. -->
The token is valid

### Additional Information
<!-- Add any other context (e.g. logs, screenshots, etc.) about the problem here. -->
This could be solved by using a subclass of the default token generator with a different [key salt](https://github.com/django/django/blob/aa4acc164d1247c0de515c959f7b09648b57dc42/django/contrib/auth/tokens.py#L13):

https://github.com/Integreat/integreat-cms/blob/c72f374e78aab800b112abb3d95f3d88c83bf2e3/src/cms/utils/account_activation_utils.py#L21-L29

title: Actions vulnerable to CSRF attacks

milestone.title: Stable release
milestone.description: All non-critical features must be finished until this milestone. If they are not finished, introduction of the new CMS will be postponed.

body: ### Describe the Bug Many server-state-changing actions like e.g. archiving, restoring, moving and deleting objects accept all HTTP methods including GET and HEAD at the moment. This means they are vulnerable to CSRF attacks because GET requests are considered safe by the [Django CSRF protection](https://docs.djangoproject.com/en/3.1/ref/csrf/). This is no limitation of Django, but in accordance with the [HTTP specification](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc7231.html#section-4.2.1), which defines GET as a read-only method without side-effects. ### Steps to Reproduce 1. Create a beautiful website containing the link `Click me to get 999999€` 2. Let a user who is currently logged into the cms as superuser click on the link ### Expected Behavior The expected result should be "HTTP 405 method not allowed" ### Actual Behavior The region "Augsburg" ceased to exist ### Additional Information :upside_down_face:

### Steps to Reproduce

1. Go to pages
2. Open page-editor for an existing page which last revision is PUBLIC.
3. Make some change (e.g. in the text)
4. Wait two minutes (until the autosave is triggered)

### Expected Behavior
A new revision is created with status DRAFT. The revision that already existed, remains unchanged with status PUBLIC.


### Actual Behavior
A new revision is created with status DRAFT. The revision that already existed, remains unchanged, but gets status DRAFT.


### Additional Information
Probably, it also makes sense to add a new status for autosave translations.

- Issue #869
- Issue #870

Autosaves of new pages should update the same draft and not create new instances every 2 minutes

Every 2 minutes a new page is created

### Additional Information

title: get_last_root_page template tag not working

labels.name: prio: medium
labels.description: Should be scheduled in the forseeable future.

milestone.title: Stable release
milestone.description: All non-critical features must be finished until this milestone. If they are not finished, introduction of the new CMS will be postponed.

body:
### Describe the Bug
<!-- A clear and concise description of what the bug is. -->
The `get_last_root_page` template tag is not working:
https://github.com/Integreat/integreat-cms/blob/develop/src/cms/templatetags/page_filters.py#L10-L20

This is because in the page QuerySet aggregation, the difference() function is used:
https://github.com/Integreat/integreat-cms/blob/a285cb3c74b2a2c501147076338e2b2a70c89bd6/src/cms/models/regions/region.py#L177

After difference(), it is not possible to use filter(), see https://docs.djangoproject.com/en/2.2/ref/models/querysets/#union

This leads to the last drop-region in the page tree being incorrectly tied to the last page in the list, not necessarily the last root page.

### Steps to Reproduce

1. Go to Page tree
2. Drag & drop page to most bottom line

### Expected Behavior
<!-- A clear and concise description of what you expected to happen. -->
The page should be placed next to the last root page

### Actual Behavior
<!-- A clear and concise description of what actually happened. -->
The page is placed next to the last page in the list

### Additional Information
<!-- Add any other context (e.g. logs, screenshots, etc.) about the problem here. -->

title: Python module path of integreat-cms not correct

labels.name: prio: medium
labels.description: Should be scheduled in the forseeable future.

labels.name: infrastructure
labels.description: Issues related to the dev or production environment

milestone.title: Stable release
milestone.description: All non-critical features must be finished until this milestone. If they are not finished, introduction of the new CMS will be postponed.

body:
### Describe the Bug
<!-- A clear and concise description of what the bug is. -->
When installing the package as non-editable (with `pipenv run pip install .` instead of `pipenv run pip install -e .`), the sub-packages get installed separately without a parent integreat-cms package:

### Steps to Reproduce

```
$ pipenv run pip install .
$ pipenv run python
>>> import importlib
>>> importlib.import_module("integreat-cms")
ModuleNotFoundError: No module named 'integreat-cms'
>>> import cms
>>> cms
<module 'cms' from '/home/timo/integreat/integreat-cms/.venv/lib/python3.7/site-packages/cms/__init__.py'>
```

### Expected Behavior
<!-- A clear and concise description of what you expected to happen. -->
I expect the integreat-cms to be a separate package with contains the sub-packages like cms, api etc.

### Actual Behavior
<!-- A clear and concise description of what actually happened. -->
The sub-packages cms, api etc. get installed at the top-level of the /lib directory of the environment.

### Additional Information
<!-- Add any other context (e.g. logs, screenshots, etc.) about the problem here. -->
The simplest fix for this might be to rename our "src" directory (again -.-) to "integreat-cms" and place an `__init__.py` inside.
Alternatively, we could add "integreat-cms" as symlink or fix the path in the packaging script by e.g. renaming the src directory, package it and rename it back...

### Describe the Bug
<!-- A clear and concise description of what the bug is. -->
In the [feedback API documentation](https://integreat.github.io/integreat-cms/autogenerated/api.v3.feedback.html), all view functions which are decorated with the [feedback_handler](https://integreat.github.io/integreat-cms/autogenerated/api.html#api.decorators.feedback_handler) are missing in the documentation, although their docstrings are fine.

### Steps to Reproduce

1. Go to the [feedback API documentation](https://integreat.github.io/integreat-cms/autogenerated/api.v3.feedback.html)
2. See missing docu (only internal functions are listed)

### Expected Behavior
<!-- A clear and concise description of what you expected to happen. -->
The docstrings of the feedback api view functions should appear in the docu

### Actual Behavior
<!-- A clear and concise description of what actually happened. -->
They are missing

### Additional Information
<!-- Add any other context (e.g. logs, screenshots, etc.) about the problem here. -->
I assume this is because the decorator is used without [functools.wraps](https://docs.python.org/3/library/functools.html#functools.wraps) which causes the decorated functions loose its meta information.

body:
### Describe the Bug
<!-- A clear and concise description of what the bug is. -->
The permalink is checked for correctness in the single page API endpoint, but in #119 we decided not to keep track of old permalinks. Instead, we will just map permalinks based on the last url parameter (the slug) and ignore the rest.

### Steps to Reproduce

1. Copy one page permalink
2. Move that page to another parent to change the permalink
3. Request this page in the single page API endpoint with the old permalink from step 1

### Expected Behavior
<!-- A clear and concise description of what you expected to happen. -->
The page should be found even if the permalink is old

### Actual Behavior
<!-- A clear and concise description of what actually happened. -->
The error `No Page matches the given url or id` is returned.

title: MultipleObjectsReturned in single page API endpoint

labels.name: prio: medium
labels.description: Should be scheduled in the forseeable future.

milestone.title: Stable release
milestone.description: All non-critical features must be finished until this milestone. If they are not finished, introduction of the new CMS will be postponed.

body:
### Describe the Bug
<!-- A clear and concise description of what the bug is. -->
The page translation slug is unique only per region and language. So if page translations are only queried by region and slug, there might be multiple objects with that conditions.

### Steps to Reproduce

1. Modify test data so that two translations of the same region but with different languages have the same slug
2. Retrieve the single page endpoint with this slug
4. See error

### Expected Behavior
<!-- A clear and concise description of what you expected to happen. -->
The page translation of the requested languages should be returned

### Actual Behavior
<!-- A clear and concise description of what actually happened. -->
The following error appears:
```
cms.models.pages.page.Page.MultipleObjectsReturned: get() returned more than one Page -- it returned 2!
```

### Proposed solution
<!-- Add any other context (e.g. logs, screenshots, etc.) about the problem here. -->

[Line 44](https://github.com/Integreat/cms-django/blob/acfe4cc079ac0326f92c22a0089019b3e6225fb7/src/api/v3/single_page.py#L44)
```
        page = get_object_or_404(
            Page, region=region, translations__slug=url.split("/")[-1]
        )
```
should become
```
        # the last path component of the url is the page translation slug
        page_translation_slug = url.split("/")[-1]
        # get page by filtering for translation slug and translation language code
        page = get_object_or_404(
            region.pages,
            translations__slug=page_translation_slug,
            translations__language__code=language_code,
        )
```

body:
### Describe the Bug
<!-- A clear and concise description of what the bug is. -->
The permission `edit_page` throws an error for region users when called on a non-existing page

### Steps to Reproduce

1. Login as region user (not superadmin or staff)
2. Click on Pages
4. See error

### Expected Behavior
<!-- A clear and concise description of what you expected to happen. -->
The page tree should appear

### Actual Behavior
<!-- A clear and concise description of what actually happened. -->
The following error appears:
```
AttributeError at /augsburg/pages/de-de/

'NoneType' object has no attribute 'region'
```

### Additional Information
<!-- Add any other context (e.g. logs, screenshots, etc.) about the problem here. -->
The error arises because `page.region` is accessed, even if no page is supplied:
```
if page.region not in user.profile.regions.all():
    return False
```
We have two possibilities here:
1. somehow inject the current region into the rule predicate and use this instead of `page.region`
2. Rely on the fact that the region permissions are checked elsewhere. E.g. the user can't open a page form in another region than he belongs to (this is already checked by the `@method_decorator(region_permission_required, name="dispatch")` in the page form) and a page form can only be used to edit pages of the current region (this is alredy checked by `page = region.pages.filter(id=kwargs.get("page_id")).first()`). title: Skip translation test in commit hooks while rebasing

milestone.title: Stable release
milestone.description: All non-critical features must be finished until this milestone. If they are not finished, introduction of the new CMS will be postponed.

body:
When rebasing branches, the commit hooks fire each time. However, the translation check uses git features that break while a rebase is going on. The rebase breaks with:
```
Not a git repository
To compare two paths outside a working tree:
usage: git diff [--no-index] <path> <path>
Your translation file is not up to date.
Please check if any strings need manual translation.
```
This could be used to check for an ongoing rebase and skip the tests: https://stackoverflow.com/questions/3921409/how-to-know-if-there-is-a-git-rebase-in-progress

title: Fix short URL copying to clipboard

milestone.title: Stable release
milestone.description: All non-critical features must be finished until this milestone. If they are not finished, introduction of the new CMS will be postponed.

body:
### Describe the Bug
Currently, the short URL is copied to the clipboard on the server (`pyperclip` module), see function `copy_short_url()` in `src/cms/views/pages/page_actions.py`.

### Expected Behavior
Users in the Web GUI should be able to copy the short URL to the clipboard. We need a JavaScript function in the page view or pages list that copies the short URL into the clipboard in the browser. The `copy_short_url()` function can probably be dropped.

Example for copying to clipboard in JavaScript: https://www.w3schools.com/howto/howto_js_copy_clipboard.asp

title: Empty slug allowed in database

labels.name: prio: medium
labels.description: Should be scheduled in the forseeable future.

milestone.title: Stable release
milestone.description: All non-critical features must be finished until this milestone. If they are not finished, introduction of the new CMS will be postponed.

body:
### Describe the Bug
<!-- A clear and concise description of what the bug is. -->
In the PageTranslation- and the EventTranslation-Model, the slug is allowed to be blank.
But no blank slug should be allowed in the database.

### Additional Information
<!-- Add any other context (e.g. logs, screenshots, etc.) about the problem here. -->
In the creation/editing-form, no slug is required (which is the desired behaviour). In case no slug is specified, a unique slug is generated when the form is submitted.
For generating a unique slug, the method "clean_slug" is used.

### Proposed Solution
<!-- A clear and concise description of the feature you would like to add, and how it solves the motivating problem. -->
Remove the mentioned constraint in the two models. But make sure that one is still allowed to leave the fields empty in the form and that a slug is generated if it is left empty.

labels.description: Issues which are well suited for hacktoberfest PRs

milestone.title: Stable release
milestone.description: All non-critical features must be finished until this milestone. If they are not finished, introduction of the new CMS will be postponed.

body:
### Describe the Bug
<!-- A clear and concise description of what the bug is. -->
At the moment, the language code field ist just a `CharField` which means it can contain any characters, including e.g. slashes. This is a problem because our routing system relies on the fact that language codes only contain characters and hyphens.

### Steps to Reproduce

1. Go to languages
2. Create a language with slash in code
3. Save

### Expected Behavior
<!-- A clear and concise description of what you expected to happen. -->
The slash should not be allowed in that field.

### Actual Behavior
<!-- A clear and concise description of what actually happened. -->
The language object can be saved which causes a lot of errors in the whole cms because the urls cannot be matched correctly anymore.

### Additional Information
<!-- Add any other context (e.g. logs, screenshots, etc.) about the problem here. -->
Please change the `CharField` of the [language model](https://github.com/Integreat/cms-django/blob/b08f2be60a9db6c8079ee923de2cd8912f550b12/src/cms/models/languages/language.py#L32) to a `SlugField` to prevent harmful special characters.

title: Drag & drop in page tree not working in Chromium

labels.name: prio: medium
labels.description: Should be scheduled in the forseeable future.

milestone.title: Stable release
milestone.description: All non-critical features must be finished until this milestone. If they are not finished, introduction of the new CMS will be postponed.

body:
### Describe the Bug
<!-- A clear and concise description of what the bug is. -->
In the page tree, only the root page can be dragged and all sub-pages can't.

### Steps to Reproduce

1. Go to a Region
2. Click on Pages
3. Try to drag & drop a page other than a page on the root level

### Expected Behavior
<!-- A clear and concise description of what you expected to happen. -->
The page can be dragged and dropped on another page or on a gap between pages.

### Actual Behavior
<!-- A clear and concise description of what actually happened. -->
The page cannot be dragged.

### Additional Information
<!-- Add any other context (e.g. logs, screenshots, etc.) about the problem here. -->
Reproduced in Chromium Version 85.0.4183.121 (Officicial Build) Arch Linux (64-Bit)

title: Development server not starting when GVZ API not reachable

labels.name: prio: low
labels.description: Not urgent, can be resolved in the distant future.

milestone.title: Stable release
milestone.description: All non-critical features must be finished until this milestone. If they are not finished, introduction of the new CMS will be postponed.

body:
### Describe the Bug
<!-- A clear and concise description of what the bug is. -->
When the [GVZ API](http://gvz.integreat-app.de/api/search/expect_empty_json) is reachable, but does not answer, the development server hangs during start, because there is no timeout defined for the api request [here](https://github.com/Integreat/cms-django/blob/f4f4c698575e975655b1333f630b5f0d6e4e034f/src/gvz_api/apps.py#L27).

### Steps to Reproduce

1. Execute `./dev-tools/run.sh` when GVZ API is reachable but does not answer (tested this morning)
2. Wait

### Expected Behavior
<!-- A clear and concise description of what you expected to happen. -->
The server should start and print a log message that the gvz api is not available

### Actual Behavior
<!-- A clear and concise description of what actually happened. -->
The server does not start

### Additional Information
<!-- Add any other context (e.g. logs, screenshots, etc.) about the problem here. -->

title: Page form changes not correctly detected

labels.name: prio: low
labels.description: Not urgent, can be resolved in the distant future.

milestone.title: Stable release
milestone.description: All non-critical features must be finished until this milestone. If they are not finished, introduction of the new CMS will be postponed.

body:
### Describe the Bug
<!-- A clear and concise description of what the bug is. -->
The page form is always marked as changed, even if not changes are performed.
(The success message is always "Translation was successfully published." when it should say "No changes detected.")

### Steps to Reproduce

1. Go to a Region, e.g. "Augsburg"
2. Click on Pages
3. Click on any page
4. Do not change anything
5. Press "publish"

### Expected Behavior
<!-- A clear and concise description of what you expected to happen. -->
The message "No changes detected." should appear

### Actual Behavior
<!-- A clear and concise description of what actually happened. -->
The message "Translation was successfully published." appears

### Additional Information
<!-- Add any other context (e.g. logs, screenshots, etc.) about the problem here. -->
The form's changed data always contains 'mirrored_page_first', even if this field was not changed.

title: Embedding live content not working

labels.name: prio: medium
labels.description: Should be scheduled in the forseeable future.

milestone.title: Stable release
milestone.description: All non-critical features must be finished until this milestone. If they are not finished, introduction of the new CMS will be postponed.

body:
### Describe the Bug
<!-- A clear and concise description of what the bug is. -->
At the moment, embedding live content in pages is not working.

### Steps to Reproduce

1. Go to a region, e.g. "Augsburg"
2. Click on a page, e.g. "Welcome"
3. In the dropdown "Embed live content" select another  region, e.g. "Nürnberg"
4. Nothing happens

### Expected Behavior
<!-- A clear and concise description of what you expected to happen. -->
The next dropdown with the page selection should appear

### Actual Behavior
<!-- A clear and concise description of what actually happened. -->
Nothing appears
### Additional Information
<!-- Add any other context (e.g. logs, screenshots, etc.) about the problem here. -->
The console and the network analysis tab reveal the traceback:

```
FieldError at /ajax/get_pages_list

Cannot resolve keyword 'title' into field.

/home/timo/job/integreat/django/src/cms/views/pages/page_actions.py in get_pages_list_ajax

432.    pages = Page.objects.filter(region__id=region_id).order_by("title")
```

So the problem is very straight forward: the `Page` model does not have a `title` attribute, thus we cannot sort by the title.

title: Models not validated properly on XLIFF import

labels.name: prio: medium
labels.description: Should be scheduled in the forseeable future.

milestone.title: Stable release
milestone.description: All non-critical features must be finished until this milestone. If they are not finished, introduction of the new CMS will be postponed.

body:
### Describe the Bug
<!-- A clear and concise description of what the bug is. -->
At the moment, all model validation is placed in the forms, because this allows for better error handling and more informative error messages in forms. However, when using different methods to create content (e.g. the xliff import), these validation methods don't work anymore. Therefore, we need also validation on the model-level.

### Steps to Reproduce

1. Go to page tree
2. Import XLIFF-file with e.g. empty page titles
3. Confirm

### Expected Behavior
<!-- A clear and concise description of what you expected to happen. -->
If the imported data is not valid, it should not be saved to the database.

### Actual Behavior
<!-- A clear and concise description of what actually happened. -->
The invalid data is imported.

title: Region list menu points to api

milestone.title: Stable release
milestone.description: All non-critical features must be finished until this milestone. If they are not finished, introduction of the new CMS will be postponed.

body:
### Describe the Bug
<!-- A clear and concise description of what the bug is. -->
The menu item for regions points to the region api and not the region list.

### Steps to Reproduce

1. Go to 'Regions'

### Expected Behavior
<!-- A clear and concise description of what you expected to happen. -->
The region list (`/regions/`) opens.

### Actual Behavior
<!-- A clear and concise description of what actually happened. -->
The region api (`/api/regions/`) opens.

### Additional Information
<!-- Add any other context (e.g. logs, screenshots, etc.) about the problem here. -->
This is because both urls have the name 'regions' and the last matching item in urlpatterns determines the actual url.

title: Manual creation of Languages results in Bugsplash at page view.

milestone.title: Stable release
milestone.description: All non-critical features must be finished until this milestone. If they are not finished, introduction of the new CMS will be postponed.

body:
### Describe the Bug
If a system is set up manually without the test data. The manual language setup results in a error when opening the list view of the pages.
![grafik](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/15608678/87561440-fc768b00-c6bc-11ea-8853-6207ba1d4b5b.png)



### Steps to Reproduce

1. Create Languages (Like German with code DE_de)
2. Create Region (Like Berlin)
3. Add Language Tree model like German -> English
4. Click on Pages and see error

### Expected Behavior
The usual list should be displayed. 


### Actual Behavior
Error message from Django.


### Additional Information
I guess this has something to do with manually setting the language code and this can't be matched by django.

title: Improve dependency checks

labels.name: prio: medium
labels.description: Should be scheduled in the forseeable future.

milestone.title: Stable release
milestone.description: All non-critical features must be finished until this milestone. If they are not finished, introduction of the new CMS will be postponed.

body:
The dependency checks in the dev tools have some issues at the moment:
- Even if the command ``gettext`` is available, ``msgfmt`` and ``msguniq`` might be missing (because there are different packages ``gettext`` and ``gettext-base``)
- It is irrelevant if _some_ version of ``python3`` is installed, when ``python3.7`` is missing
- The check for ``python3.7-dev`` on Ubuntu does not work on Ubuntu 20.04
- Netcat is used in run.sh but might be missing on some distros

title: Add custom development header to CORS configuration

labels.name: prio: low
labels.description: Not urgent, can be resolved in the distant future.

milestone.title: Stable release
milestone.description: All non-critical features must be finished until this milestone. If they are not finished, introduction of the new CMS will be postponed.

body:
In #370 I forgot about the custom development header `x-integreat-development` which is used to differentiate actual traffic from dev traffic in the statistics.

Thus, we have to add 
```
from corsheaders.defaults import default_headers

CORS_ALLOW_HEADERS = list(default_headers) + [
    'x-integreat-development',
]
```
to `src/backend/settings.py`.

title: Don't use objects.get in best_language_title()

milestone.title: Stable release
milestone.description: All non-critical features must be finished until this milestone. If they are not finished, introduction of the new CMS will be postponed.

body:
Reproduce bug:
There must be at least one page without english translation. Then edit a page in the english backend. => Error

Reason:
To show the page in the page mirroring drop down menu, the root language of the region is used. A language node of the region is chosen by `LanguageTreeNode.objects.get(region__id=self.region.id)`.
But get() apparently only works if there is excactly one matching object. So it would only work if the region had only one language at all.

title: IntegrityError in language tree

milestone.title: Base Functionality
milestone.description: Issues in this milestone must be solved first because they provide very basic functionality.

body:
I just found a bug causing an `IntegrityError` in the language tree. The error can be reproduced reliably in the current state of the develop branch.

Steps to reproduce:
- In the network admin view:
  - Create a new region
  - Create at least two languages (in the following steps, we assume the two languages to be German and Englisch, works with any other languages as well)
- In the region view (in the region we just created):
  - Create a new language node for the base language (German in this example)
  - **Bug occurs in the next steps, therefore I provide a more precise description of the following steps:** in the language tree view, click on "create language tree node"
  - Choose "English" as language, "German" as source language, check the checkbox for language activation
  - click on "save", a success message should show up
  - click on "save" again without changing any form fields
  - now the form fields should have the following contents:
    - language: "English"
    - source language: "German"
    - activate language: is checked (`true`)
  - change language field to "German", as all languages can be chosen again
  - now the form fields should have the following contents:
    - language: "German"
    - source language: "German"
    - activate language: is checked (`true`)
  - click on "save" again
  - `IntegrityError` occurs
